name: CareCalls
description:
CareCalls helps you remember to do important things and/or checks that you are ok throughout the day, providing independence and peace of mind.

CareCalls works by delivering reminders and check-ins by phone call or text (sms) throughout the day, whenever they are needed. Messages can be personalised to your exact needs and if, you don't answer, we can inform up to three people by text, phone or email to say they should make sure you are ok.

Watch our new explainer video: https://carecalls.io/explainer-video

Features

  • Available to the entire of the UK and USA
  • Available to anyone with a landline or mobile phone
  • No installation or delivery required
  • Pre-recorded reminders/check-ins can be recorded by family members, carers or CareCalls staff, different messages can be delivered at different times
  • Easy to pause, edit or cancel services via our phone customer service or online dashboard
  • Online dashboard shows carers which reminders/check-ins have been responded to

Services

One-off pre-recorded reminders | Free & unlimited usage

  • Perfect for one-off appointments and arrangements e.g doctors appointments
  • Contacts someone once on a given date and time
  • Delivers a personalised pre-recorded message reminder
  • CareCalls can alert 1 person if there is no response

Repeat pre-recorded reminders/check-ins | 30 day free trial then £12/month

  • Perfect for regular personal/household tasks or checking-in
  • Can contact someone as many times as are needed each day, any time 24/7
  • Delivers a personalised pre-recorded reminder/check-in
  • CareCalls can alert up to three people if there is no response

New Live caller service |  Starting at £122/month

  • Delivered over the phone by a professional carer
  • Perfect for in-depth check-ins and tackling loneliness
  • As many calls as are needed each week

Core info

Areas Available

National

Costs

Full/partial funding is available for eligible customers. All services include 30-day free trial. The full cost is only £12 per month (Inc VAT) all inclusive. Free on-time reminder service available

Email

support@carecalls.co.uk

Phone

0330 058 8244

Customer service availability

Main customer service hours

9.00 – 17.00 Monday to Sunday

Reduced availability customer service hours

17.00 – 21.00 Monday to Sunday

Service availability

24/7

Language support

Customer service and online dashboard in English. Reminders & check-ins can be delivered in any language.

Funding sources

Private, local authority, national/central government


Who we help

CareCalls has helped over 3000 people by delivering over two million calls. CareCalls can be used by anyone but many of our users have memory issues or are at risk in their homes due to falls or health emergencies. As part of this, we support those managing:

  • Poor memory
  • Frailty and balance issues
  • Learning disabilities
  • Dementia
  • Diabetes
  • Parkinson’s
  • Brain damage
  • Huntington's
  • Motor neuron
  • Spinal muscular atrophy.

We also provide peace of mind for carers and professionals who support vulnerable individuals.

Impact

  • Helped over 3000 carers and care receivers with over two million calls delivered so far.
  • We have a 4.8 star Trustpilot rating. When asked, 82% of users said they would struggle without the service.
  • Worked with 15+ companies, local authorities and hospitals
  • Over 82% of users asked said they would struggle if product no longer existed, demonstrating product market fit.
  • Winner of a UnLtd Transform Ageing - £50k Scale up grant + recent 30k Thrive fund.

Case studies and reviews

Case studies: https://carecalls.io/category/case-studies/

Reviews: https://carecalls.io/reviews

organization.name: TIDE (Together in Dementia Everyday)
organization.description:
Imagine a collective of unpaid carers of people with dementia with the advocacy skills, knowledge and passion for making positive change for everyone impacted by dementia. Thanks to the work of tide, you don’t have to imagine. Tide works side by side with carers to ensure that their voices are heard. The foundations of tide were born out of the daily struggle that a group of women experienced in looking after family members with dementia. They decided that they did not want their experiences to become a reality for future carers. Out of this powerful commitment, tide the charity was born.  

Here at tide, we walk alongside carers. Every step of the way.  All that we do is grounded in the experience of the thousands of carers we have worked with over the years. We are continually inspired by the courageous people who come forward to add their voice to a growing movement. We see their confidence grow and lives change as carers realise the powerful impact of their voices. This is what motivates us. This is what keeps us moving forward.  

Whether you are a current or former carer of someone with dementia, or a professional working with carers, tide is here for you. Join us and let's make the world a better place for everyone living with dementia in the UK.

name: Changing Lives Through Changing Minds
description:
Changing Lives through Changing Minds provide high quality, evidence-based therapy service for children, young people and their families that are effective, efficient and sustainable.

The range of services on offer includes:

Therapy services

Our therapeutic offer includes individual sessions, group work and family therapy. In addition, we provide training for professionals, parents/carers, provide consultation and clinical supervision.​

Alternative Therapeutic Provision

Changing Lives Through Changing Minds is an established alternative education provision, underpinned with therapeutic theory and practice.

Occupational therapy

Occupational therapy can help babies, infants, children, and young people to grow, learn, have fun, socialise and play so they can develop, thrive, and reach their full potential.

CAMHS

Commissioned as an approved provider of therapeutic services by the Integrated Care Board (ICB) to provide therapeutic services on behalf of North Lincolnshire Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services (CAMHS).

Referrals are only accepted through North Lincolnshire CAMHS Service.

Training and Consultation

Our therapeutic team provides a variety of training courses, workshops and consultation opportunities.

Volunteer and student placements

As a Community Interest Company we believe that we are in a privileged position to provide opportunities for people of all ages to learn and develop, skills, knowledge and experience.

Please visit the website or ring for more information and advice on the services listed.

name: Children's Disability Team
description:
The Children's Disability Team support children transitioning to or in education from ages 0-25; who attend an educational provision in North Lincolnshire .

The Team supports all children with physical disabilities to access the curriculum through direct teaching, training and support for provisions.

The team is made up of experts from Education and Health backgrounds.

They support children and young people with physical disabilities in the following ways:

  • direct teaching
  • assessment for specialist equipment
  • assessment of classroom environment to ensure equal access to the curriculum.
  • assessment of school layout to ensure full access.
  • training for staff to better understand PD needs
  • moving and handling training for education provisions.

The Team supports the Early Help process by attending meetings, providing reports and where necessary taking the lead professionals role. Referrals are accepted from all stakeholders.

Our definition of Physical Disabilities is that laid out by the 2010 Equalities Act.
(1)A person (P) has a disability if
(a) has a physical or mental impairment, and
(b) the impairment has a substantial and long-term adverse effect on their ability to carry out normal day-to-day activities.

Further information is available on the SEND local Offer website - SEND Local Offer | Physical Disability - SEND Local Offer (northlincs.gov.uk)

name: Children's Therapy Services
description:
The Children’s Therapy Team in North Lincolnshire includes the following paediatric services:

  • Speech and Language Therapy
  • Occupational Therapy
  • Physiotherapy
  • Nutrition and Dietetic Service

Services are offered to children and young people 0-16/19 years of age. The team is based in Scunthorpe but works across the North Lincolnshire area. Referrals are received from a range of sources including Consultants, GPs, Health Visitors, schools, early years providers, other professionals (for example Portage, ASET, Education Psychologist) and parents. We have attached further information showing the pathway and criteria for referrals to our services.

Appointments are offered within clinics, schools, and special schools. Home visits are offered to children dependent upon their clinical need, and children will also be seen within a hospital setting as appropriate. An overview of the pathway for support and therapy has been included which shows the journey a child may take following their assessment our teams.

Our main aims are to help children and young people to:

  • Develop and make progress at school/nursery to the best of their ability
  • Be as independent as possible and make choices for themselves
  • Have satisfying relationships at home and at school
  • Participate and feel confident
  • Be free from discomfort, stay well and be safe.

Further information is available on the NHS website - Children's Services - Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust (nlg.nhs.uk)

organization.name: Children's Therapy Team
organization.description:
The team is made up of occupational therapists, physiotherapists and speech and language 
therapists and is community based, working in nurseries, mainstream schools, special 
schools, children’s centres, community clinics, people’s homes and the child development 
centre. We work closely with parents and other professionals, including health visitors, early 
years practitioners and family workers.

name: Chopped Liver and Unions
description:
“The world is changed by the women you push too far”

It’s 1956.  On the international stage the Suez crisis hits and Soviet tanks roll into Hungary.  In the UK Sara Wesker is writing a letter.

Back in the day Sara led the “singing strikers of 1928” to win better working conditions for the female garment workers in the East End.  Later she served on the Central Committee of the Communist Party, fought at the Battle of Cable Street and inspired one of our most famous playwrights.  But did her love of the cause cost her the love of her life? Was it worth it? And does anybody care?

Mark Women’s History Month by joining us to celebrate the life of this remarkable woman who lived in extraordinary times and has all but been written out of history. 

This 5-star reviewed, OffFest nominated play, has sold out in New York, the Edinburgh Festival Fringe, and in theatres across the UK. 

Please visit the website to book your tickets.

organization.name: Westcliff Community Works
organization.description:
Westcliff Drop-In Centre was established in 1987 and became a registered charity in 1997.  The main focus of the Centre was to work as an independent, community project responding to the needs of the residents of the Westcliff housing estate and surrounding areas.  In 2011 the Drop-In incorporated as a company limited by guarantee. The Board comprises of 8 local residents and 2 associate members.

In May 2018 we moved from our centre, which was earmarked for demolition, into a new community building and changed our name to Westcliff Community Works.

Westcliff Community Works (WCW) is a community anchor organisation “our vision” is for a thriving, united, joyful community filled with inspiration; where all residents have the opportunities and confidence to prosper and lead happy and healthy lives.

organization.name: Scunthorpe Salvation Army
organization.description:
The Salvation Army is a worldwide Christian church and registered charity, which has been fighting against social inequality and transforming lives for over 150 years.
The Salvation Army expresses its faith through charitable action by working at the heart of communities across the UK and Ireland. We have 650 churches and community centres where we offer friendship, practical help and support to some of the most disadvantaged people in our communities.

Motivated by our Christian faith we offer practical support and services to all who need them, regardless of ethnicity, religion, gender or sexual orientation. Our work includes:

Homelessness
Modern slavery
Poverty
Addiction
Campaigning and social policy
Older people
Community - debt advice, unemployment, isolation
Your support allows us to respond to the people who need us most. Across the UK and Ireland, we:

Provide over 3,000 places every night in 82 lifehouses
Supported over 13,000 people through our Employment service
Supported over 11,000 victims referred to our modern slavery services
The United Kingdom and Ireland is part of the wider international Salvation Army, which changes lives in 131 countries around the world.

organization.name: The Arc
organization.description:
We are a friendly well-being hub based in the heart of the Westcliff community and we’re part of Ongo, which means all profit we make is put back into the local community. 

Call into our cafe for a cuppa, find out about events and activities, rent a room, catch up with old friends, or meet new ones. We also have free wifi, a Post Office and loads more to get involved in.

There’s a whole range of support and training available here at The Arc. From our Employment Support Coaches and Housing Officers, to agencies we work with like Humberside Police, North Lindsey College and North Lincolnshire Council. So if you need training or support, come and speak to us.

name: Community Cafe
description:
The church is open each Tuesday morning from 10am to 11.30 am as a community cafe.

All are welcome to come along to enjoy a cuppa and some good conversation.

Please drop in or contact for more information.

name: Community Health Inclusion Nursing Team
description:
The NHS Community Health Inclusion Team will be visiting Victor House every Wednesday & Friday  afternoons.

If you require wound care, foot care, managing diabetes, health, wellbeing or nutrition advice then please visit Victor House.

This list is not exhaustive and the team are able to provide relevant support for a vast array of conditions.

organization.name: Victor House
organization.description:
Victor House Is a Safe Hub offering vital support to people who are homeless or at risk of homelessness. Victor House opens seven days a week, including Christmas Day 2-6pm and Boxing Day 8-10pm providing hot drinks  and donations of food are provided when available, essential support services are offered based upon, strength based conversations and care & support needs identified. 
Showering/laundry facilities are also available.

Night Provision is available and this is based on visitors completing a form daily - with support - from the team at Victor House in order for application to be considered based on priority need.

organization.name: North Lincolnshire Council Community Meals Service
organization.description: The North Lincolnshire Council Community Meals Service is by referral only. Please contact adult social care for an assessment.

name: Community Stroll & Coffee Morning (The Pods)
description:
Community Stroll & Coffee morning at The Pods 

Monday mornings 10am-11.30am 

10am-10.30am Meet at the Pods entrance for a gentle stroll through central park for some fresh air and beautiful scenery. This walk is fully accessible and 0.7miles.

10.30am-11.30am Join the Community Wellbeing team for a hot drink, and a wellbeing social chat inside the Pods.

Start your week right!

Join other adults from your community to engage in positive interaction through discussions around current affairs, local area knowledge, health and wellbeing advice and a dash of humour! A safe and welcoming space.

Situated inside the café at the Pods, the group is central to lots of other activities, so afterwards why not join new friends for a swim, or a trip to the gym? Ask one of the friendly team about membership packages.

All adults welcome, no need to book just come along.

organization.name: Community Wellbeing
organization.description: The aim of the Community Wellbeing team is to reduce social isolation, empower community groups and reconnect communities

name: Community Support
description:
Free employment support

Based in Scunthorpe, our employment support service is completely free and can be accessed by anybody living in North Lincolnshire.

So what do we actually mean by Employment Support? Well that depends on you :)

Choose from a range of free services from:

  • Employment skills
  • Industry training
  • Getting back on your feet
  • Mental health
  • Self-confidence
  • Interview skills
  • Volunteering and work placements

We offer this through a variety of ways including training sessions, mentoring, clubs, days out, progression sessions, counselling and life coaching.

Click for more detail about our services and to learn about all of the projects we have available

​​​​​​​Please give us a ring on 01724 279900 option 6 for all enquiries

organization.name: Ongo Communities
organization.description:
Ongo is a partnership designed to give something back to communities. It's purpose is to look for new opportunities which will ultimately help the people of North Lincolnshire.

All profit made through the partnership is reinvested back into the organisation to help build new homes and invest further in community initiatives.

Our community hubs are in place to bring communities together and provide a place for people to go for help and advice.

name: Community walks
description:
The main purpose of our group is to promote walking and the use of footpaths in our parish for the health and well being of locals and visitors. In doing this we also want to promote the care and maintenance of our environment. Everyone and anyone is welcome to attend. There is no charge for the walk. We always start at a local venue and aim to finish with drinks and biscuits. The walks are generally between three and five miles long. Well behaved dogs on leads are welcome.

We email all those interested two weeks prior to the walk. Please add your name to this list by emailing the secretary at the address above.

Haxey Parish is criss-crossed by over 40 miles of footpaths and bridleways. Walkers are faced with gentle slopes and flat fields interspersed with small woodlands ( including 2 SSSI sites ). With the River Idle walk on the southern boundary, a delightful wooded walk along a disused railway line, a maze of ancient rights of way and 3 long distance footpaths through the area there is plenty of variety.

name: Complementary Service
description:
The Complementary service is offered to patients who visit the hospice either as an inpatient, a day-care patient in the Wellbeing Centre or as an outpatient whom is known to the hospice and has been referred from another service within Lindsey Lodge. The therapies that are available across the hospice as a whole are Reiki, hand massage, foot massage, slow stroke massage, guided relaxation, reflexology and homeopathy.

​​​​​​​The Complementary team consist of both paid staff and volunteers and the service is covered a minimum of 5 days per week. Every afternoon in the WBC a group therapy session on relaxation is carried out for patients to attend from the day care or inpatient unit.

organization.name: Lindsey Lodge Hospice and Healthcare
organization.description:
Lindsey Lodge Hospice provides care for adults with life limiting illnesses and aims to provide specialist palliative care for day and inpatients to the highest standard, consisting of symptom management, emotional support and end of life care.

We provide a wide range of services including symptom management, physiotherapy and a lymphoedema service, as well as complimentary therapy, nursing and practical care, emergency care, end of life care along with bereavement and family support services.

name: Confidential Listening service
description:
Confidential Listening service is a 1 to 1 service for people who struggle with mild to moderate and more common mental health issues like depression and anxiety. This gives you the chance to speak to one of the teams in confidence, discuss any issues you may have, and explore effective ways of coping. 

Please note that this service is only available by appointment.

The service is available by appointment only.  Please note that in order to access this service you would need to complete an initial assessment first.  To book an initial assessment please call 01724 279500.

**If you need more urgent or out of hours support see below**

Haven is a crisis prevention service for people 16 years and over. Trained support workers can support people to manage thoughts of self-harm, low mood, and anxiety, to help prevent them from reaching crisis point. Haven is operating every day from 4 pm until midnight. To access Haven service please call 01724 279500, leave a message and one of the trained staff members will call you back.
pc_attendingAccess_additionalInfo: Initial assessment

organization.name: North Lincolnshire Mind
organization.description:
We are here to help you in your recovery journey and whenever you need mental health support. We believe that everyone should have access to good mental health support whenever they need it.

Here at North Lincolnshire Mind, we have created a safe and supportive environment where we provide a variety of services from 1 to 1 Confidential Listening service to recovery-focused groups and social support sessions.

name: Connect Church Ashby Road
description:
Welcome to Connect Church!

Regardless of your background, tradition, or circumstances,
we are passionate about walking with you as you explore the Christian faith.

Say hello, get connected, and join the family.

Sunday Service

Everyone is welcome to our Sunday service to meet new people, and to explore the Christian faith with others.

The service take places at our Connect Church on Ashby Road building. 

Please visit the Connect Church website for more information: Connect Church – One Church Multiple Locations (weareconnectchurch.co.uk)

organization.name: Connect Church
organization.description:
Connect Church is a new expression with a significant heritage.

Though we launched as a brand new and distinct church in 2020, our history actually goes back more than 100 years.

On 13th November 1920 a church service was held in an old YMCA building on Scunthorpe High Street and a new faith community was born. After a few moves and a temporary closure during the Second World War, the community known as Scunthorpe Baptist Church found its home on Ashby Road.

Almost exactly a century after that first service the members of the church made the audacious and bold decision to close and reopen as ‘Connect Church’; a new venture built from the ground up to meet the challenges and opportunities of the 21st Century world.

name: Connect Church Crosby
description:
Welcome to Connect Church!

Regardless of your background, tradition, or circumstances,
we are passionate about walking with you as you explore the Christian faith.

Say hello, get connected, and join the family.

Sunday Service

Everyone is welcome to our Sunday service to meet new people, and to explore the Christian faith with others.

The service takes place at CrobyONE. 

Please visit the Connect Church website for more information: Connect Church – One Church Multiple Locations (weareconnectchurch.co.uk)

organization.description:
Connect Church is a new expression with a significant heritage.

Though we launched as a brand new and distinct church in 2020, our history actually goes back more than 100 years.

On 13th November 1920 a church service was held in an old YMCA building on Scunthorpe High Street and a new faith community was born. After a few moves and a temporary closure during the Second World War, the community known as Scunthorpe Baptist Church found its home on Ashby Road.

Almost exactly a century after that first service the members of the church made the audacious and bold decision to close and reopen as ‘Connect Church’; a new venture built from the ground up to meet the challenges and opportunities of the 21st Century world.

name: Cook4Life - Healthy Lifestyles
description:
Our Cook4Life groups  offer educational and practical support for those looking to develop their skillsets! The Cook4Life programme offers the following:

  • FREE 6-week course available

  • Learn basic cooking skills

  • Fun, friendly and relaxed atmosphere

  • Led by experts, guiding you along the way

  • Learn to make healthy, nutritious meals

Held in community hubs throughout North Lincolnshire, our groups provide advice on all aspects of healthy living in a relaxed, friendly environment.

Sessions are bookable by appointment only, for more information or to register, contact Healthy Lifestyles to speak with a member of our team!

organization.name: North Lincolnshire Healthy Lifestyles
organization.description:
The North Lincolnshire Healthy Lifestyle team brings together lifestyle support services in one place. This makes it easier for local people to access help and support for a range of issues at once.

You can access the team at local venues such as leisure centres, community hubs, and some GP practices.

Our friendly healthy lifestyle facilitators can support you with:

achieving and maintaining a healthy weight
stopping smoking
reducing alcohol use
signposting to wider local supporting services
Our service is available via self referrals or referrals made through your GP practice.

name: Coping with Life Support Group
description:
Sometimes we all struggle with stress and worry and we might need a bit of help in coping with it. Coping with Life is a short four-session support group that would provide you with tools and techniques on how to increase resilience, become more assertive, and help manage worry and stress. Coping with Life course runs every Friday from 1pm to 2pm. Please call our office to register. 

**If you need more urgent support, please see below**

Safe Space Support Line (previously Haven) is a crisis prevention service for people 17 years and over. Trained support workers can support people to manage thoughts of self-harm, low mood, and anxiety, to help prevent them from reaching crisis point. Operating every day from 4pm until midnight. To access service please call 01724 279500, leave a message and one of the trained staff members will call you back.

organization.name: North Lincolnshire Mind
organization.description:
We are here to help you in your recovery journey and whenever you need mental health support. We believe that everyone should have access to good mental health support whenever they need it.

Here at North Lincolnshire Mind, we have created a safe and supportive environment where we provide a variety of services from 1 to 1 Confidential Listening service to recovery-focused groups and social support sessions.

name: Counselling
description:
Counselling, and talking therapies in general, involves talking to a trained professional about the things you are perhaps struggling with, experiencing or want to better understand. While there are several different therapies and techniques available, the aims are the same:

To give you a safe place to talk to a trained professional without judgement.
To help you make sense of difficult feelings/emotions and understand yourself.
To help you resolve complicated issues or find ways to manage them.
To help you recognise unhelpful patterns and/or behaviours and find ways to change them (if you want to).

There are many benefits to counselling. While it was previously seen as a final option for those who have reached crisis point, now it is recognised as a preventative measure, a form of self-care in managing difficult feelings before they get worse.
As said, therapy can help you manage and cope with a number of things, including relationship problems, bereavement, anger, stress, depression and anxiety.

This list is not exhaustive. Counselling can help with long-term physical health problems, difficult life events such as losing your job and divorce, trauma and many other mental health concerns. Sometimes, simply speaking to a professional, and not your loved ones, can make all the difference. Friends don’t always understand, whereas a therapist can offer understanding and direction, while you speak in a safe, confidential space.

organization.name: New Beginnings
organization.description:
New Beginnings Personal Training and Wellness Facility offer the highest quality services and treatments for mind, body and wellness.


Our services are provided by highly qualified personal trainers who are experts in their field and hand selected by the New Beginning's owner and founder, Stacey Greenfield. 


Feeling good is a complex issue. Health is at the heart of it, but psychology has a role to play as well, and we need to have that feeling of looking good.


New Beginnings brings together a range of services for mind, body and wellness to help our clients be fit and well inside and out. The best way to great health is to look after the whole body, not just the physical aspects but also the mental issues as well; as the saying goes "Healthy Body, Healthy Mind".


Looking after your health as a whole package is so important, yet it is something that far too many people sadly neglect.  Our range of services has been put together in such a way that many of them complement each other.


Our fully equipped personal training studio allows clients to work out in comfort and privacy. In addition this allows clients to also benefit from the expert advice of our personal trainers either with one-to-one support based on their individual goals or small group classes such as yoga.


Our New Beginnings founder is also qualified in nutrition and is available to put together the best possible programme to assist with weight loss, fitness issues and helping to create a health body. For those clients who have issues with food, we can assist with this. Helping you to create a more positive and healthier person both on the outside and as well as on the inside can give you the real boost of confidence that can be invaluable in both a professional and personal capacity. 

From counselling to life coaching, our highly professional team can help you to overcome whatever it is that is preventing you from achieving your goals.

name: Counselling & Support
description:
The Counselling and family support service offers pre and post bereavement Support to Hospice Patients, their families and carers.

We support patients in coming to terms with their own life limiting/palliative illness and gently encourages important conversations to take place between family members if needed.

After the death of a loved one we provide one to one emotional support and Counselling. We offer a safe confidential space to explore feelings of grief, loss and sadness.

A weekly Bereavement group is held for anyone within the local Community. This is a chance for the bereaved to express their feelings of loss in a warm and safe environment. It provides the opportunity to meet others in a similar situation which often brings added comfort.

organization.name: Lindsey Lodge Hospice and Healthcare
organization.description:
Lindsey Lodge Hospice provides care for adults with life limiting illnesses and aims to provide specialist palliative care for day and inpatients to the highest standard, consisting of symptom management, emotional support and end of life care.

We provide a wide range of services including symptom management, physiotherapy and a lymphoedema service, as well as complimentary therapy, nursing and practical care, emergency care, end of life care along with bereavement and family support services.

name: Counselling and Counselling Supervision
description:
About me

I offer counselling in a wholly person centred way- focusing on you, my client.

Practice description

As a Person Centred Counsellor my aim is to be open and honest, non-judgemental, warm and empathic. This helps us to build a good therapeutic relationship where you can speak about your experiences, worries and fears which we can work through together.

I’m also a trained mindfulness practitioner and I have the interest and knowledge to support your health and well-being- this can be especially helpful if you’re experiencing anxiety. 

Training, qualifications & experience

I have a wide range of qualifications, training and experience from working at Rape Crisis, Youth Counselling, various colleges, local authorities and Relate. I’m happy to support young people, adults and couples embracing difference and diversity.

organization.name: Kelly Sargent Counselling
organization.description: Counselling and Counselling supervision available online or by phone.

name: Counselling/Herbal Medicine/Supervision Services
description:
Hello, I am a qualified and experienced counsellor, counselling supervisor and trainer.

Counselling is a form of talking therapy that can be used at anytime to support you in dealing with a range of issues such as:

– Difficult life events such as bereavement and loss, relationship breakdown, job loss.

– Upsetting or traumatic events, whether this is recent or happened a long time ago.

– Difficult emotions such as guilt, sadness, grief, anger and low self esteem.

– Long term physical health problems.

– Depression, anxiety and trauma response.

As a professional who is also trained in social and therapeutic horticulture I particularly enjoy working with people outside using nature as our therapy room. Nature can make us feel and think better and we also benefit from the movement as we take a gentle walk and connect with other living things around us. I offer an initial free call for us to connect and explore how we might work together. If you would like to speak please get in touch.
pc_attendingAccess_additionalInfo: We can work together in person, online either inside or outside. If we work together outside we will discuss and agree the best location to meet.

organization.name: Lifecycles Herbal Medicine and Counselling
organization.description: Qualified and experienced Counsellor, Herbalist and NLP Practitioner, supporting mental health and wellbeing.

name: Craft Group - Messingham Community Hub
description:
This is an informal crafting afternoon for anyone to come along and work on their own craft and have a chat with other like-minded people. 

Every Wednesday afternoon  2pm - 4.30pm

£1 per person / session

organization.name: Messingham Parish Council
organization.description:
Messingham has a long history and was mentioned in the Domesday Book. It has always been a relatively large community but following World War II there was considerable housing development and the village has trebled in size to its present population of 4,000 inhabitants. Up to the beginning of the 20th Century agriculture was the main occupation but with the introduction of steelmaking to North Lincolnshire and the development of less labour intensive farming methods, land workers drifted into more industrial pursuits in nearby Scunthorpe.

The present day village boasts a public library, a medical centre, pharmacy, four public houses, a wine bar, two restaurants, tea room, café, four takeaway outlets, three small supermarkets (one incorporating the Post Office) and a number of smaller shops, including hairdressers, beautician, bakery, florist and a carpet shop. There are two places of worship – the Church of the Holy Trinity and the Methodist Church.

Messingham is a lively village with a variety of thriving organisations, many of which use the spacious Village Hall as their venue. Leisure is well catered for with a well-equipped playing field, which includes a young Children’s Play Area and a  Multi Use Games Area; and an additional 20 acre recreation area which hosts, among other activities, gymkhanas, the annual Messingham Horse & Foal Show, and Messingham Junior football.

name: Crafternoon at Luddington Village Hall
description: Weekly Crafternoon - Crafters get together

name: Crafty Chatters
description:
Social group where you can meet people for a chat and coffee/tea and if you want bring along some craft if you want to.

Please just turn up. 

Please note the group sometimes does not open on Bank Holidays if there is not enough interest on the day.

Session is £3 - any money left over is saved towards a buffet lunch or day trip.

name: Creative Stitch – Wildlife & Nature Workshop
description:
Learn how to create beautiful textile artwork of wildlife and nature using a sewing machine with Holly Capstick from Thread and Press CIC who will guide you in creating a beautiful piece of artwork on fabric.

You will learn how to create a simple paint layer onto fabric. You don't need to be a skilled artist or even have done any painting before - we have lots of step-by-step instructions and will guide you.

You will then learn how to use free-motion machine embroidery to add detail to your work and “draw” with threads and colours. Holly is an experienced teacher and will show you all stages from start to finish.

No experience required, even if you have never sewn before

£75pp

name: Creativity for Positivity
description:
Join workshop leaders Sheila McGrath and Sally Flint for an afternoon of fun, mindfulness and creativity.

Designed to nurture your well-being, the workshop will include mindful practices such as journaling, meditation and creative writing. In this supportive space, you will explore techniques for self-expression, and use writing as a tool for reflection and personal growth.

Whether you are new to writing or more experienced, this session offers a chance to connect, create, and develop skills for maintaining mental wellness.

Led by Sheila McGrath, an experienced mental health nurse, and Sally Flint, a teacher, librarian, and writer, this is a fun, creative workshop, and not intended as a clinical session.

While the focus is on positivity and the session may feel therapeutic, the workshop leaders are not offering expert medical advice, just an opportunity to explore creativity in a relaxed and enjoyable environment.

All welcome. Suitable for 16+

This is a free workshop, but places are limited and need to be booked at Creativity for Positivity

Click on ‘register’ and complete your details, and you will receive an email confirming that you have been added to the attendee list.

If you experience any difficulties booking or have any questions about the workshop, please contact library.enquiries@northlincs.gov.uk

name: Crosby Breastfeeding Support Group
description:
A drop-in breastfeeding support group run by trained peer supporters for mothers and their little ones at any stage on their breastfeeding journey. Group runs in term time only - check school website for term dates - Term Dates - Oasis Academy Henderson Avenue

Partners and siblings are welcome too. Please come along to meet other breastfeeding mums, share experiences or simply socialise.

You don't need to have any issues or concerns to access the group but if you do we will try our best to help you or signpost you to the people who will provide the right support.

name: Crosby Carer Peer Support Group
description:
Carer Peer Support Groups can offer empathetic support that only another Carer can give. They are a great way to meet other Carers, socialise, develop friendships and share information.

Carers meet every fortnight on a Wednesday from 1pm to 3pm at April Lodge, Ferry Road, Scunthorpe, DN15 8LS and you will be made very welcome.

Talk to us if you feel you cannot attend because of your caring role on 01652 650585 or email info@carerssupportcentre.com.

organization.name: Carers' Support Service

name: Crosby Community Hub

Crosby Community Hub is a Day Centre for vulnerable adults based in Scunthorpe and surrounding areas. It is owned by its parent company Foresight which provides the same services in Grimsby. 

The hall space at the Hub is also available for hire outside of the day centres running time from £15.

organization.name: Foresight North East Lincolnshire
organization.description: At Foresight, we are a dedicated organisation committed to meeting the needs and requirements of disabled individuals, their families, and carers in North and North East Lincolnshire. Our mission is to provide the way forward for the disabled community, empowering individuals to a new beginning, a brighter future, and a full and enjoyable life.

Join our welcoming social group, every Monday, for friendly conversation, light refreshments and the choice to take part in a range of table top activities such as Dominoes, cards and word searches.

What better way to start the week then having a chat and a laugh with new friends?

We look forward to welcoming you.

We have over 100 members and we have regular talks and demonstrations on a monthly basis.  We run gardening themed days out and holidays.  We hold regular plant stalls and social events and generally encourage local people, especially children, to become involved in horticulture.

The Crowle coffee morning is held once a fortnight at Crowle Community Hub Market Place, DN174LA on Monday from 10-11 where you can join us for light refreshments and a chat.  Come along and take part, make new friends, keep up to date with what else is going on in the area in a welcome and friendly environment.

organization.name: Community Wellbeing
organization.description: The aim of the Community Wellbeing team is to reduce social isolation, empower community groups and reconnect communities

name: Crowle Community Hub
description:
Our community hubs

Our community hubs are based throughout North Lincolnshire. They make it easier for residents to access information, advice and support, and take part in activities to improve their health and wellbeing.

The hub spaces are open to everyone. They are a central point in the community with support and activities for all – young and old.

Aim of the hubs

The aim of the hubs is to:

  • improve health and wellbeing and outcomes for local people
  • develop skills and employability for residents, with a clear path to skilled jobs
  • create employment and volunteering opportunities
  • reduce social isolation by connecting residents to activities and services in the community
  • provide information, advice and guidance to local people based on individual need.

The offer in the hubs is built around the five steps to wellbeing. Easy-to-access programmes such as physical activity, social action, volunteering, health and wellbeing, employability and more are available. These activities enable people to maintain their independence, improve their health and wellbeing and develop a range of skills.

Direct help, advice and guidance is provided to meet the needs of residents and enable them to access the support and information they need to live safe, well, prosperous and connected lives.

Hub programmes

Examples of what is available to residents through the hubs programme includes:

  • bespoke IT training sessions to enable residents to take advantage of the social and economic benefits of being online
  • health checks for eligible residents as well as a range of specialist surgeries at certain times throughout the week
  • adult education and family learning sessions
  • general advice and support on council and community services
  • physical activity sessions to enable residents to get more active
  • health sessions around common medical conditions such as cardio-vascular disease and rehabilitation programme for people with chronic joint pain
  • social wellbeing activities that bring the community together such as healthy eating sessions, book clubs and knit and natter sessions.
  • a range of activities for children and young people which support wellbeing, including clubs and school holiday activities.

Facilities within the hub spaces include sport and leisure facilities, public libraries, digital technology, lifelong learning facilities, community kitchens and much more.

The flexible spaces are intended to support a range of community-led activity provided for by a range of organisations across public and voluntary sectors, who can provide additional health and wellbeing support. By working through these integrated approaches, members of the community receive joined up, quality, consistent information and support.

Community Hubs are located across North Lincolnshire within central and accessible locations in:

  • Ashby
  • Barton
  • Brigg
  • Crowle
  • Epworth
  • Riddings
  • Scunthorpe

To find the address of your local hub see the libraries and community hubs page

If you are feeling lonely or isolated, then please feel free to contact your local community hub on the phone numbers below. Or just drop in and say hello. You will always be given a warm welcome.

Contact

  • Barton and Winterton –01724 296808
  • Brigg  – 01724 296776

organization.name: North Lincolnshire Community Hubs
organization.description:
North Lincolnshire Council connects residents with their communities through a network of locality-based community hubs enabling independence and wellbeing. 
The Community Hubs support residents by providing a safe environment to access information, activities, skills and services, and by providing the tools to enhance personal knowledge, confidence and a sense of belonging.  
The majority of North Lincolnshire residents live within a 15 minute drive of their local community hub. Hubs are located in each of the following locations Scunthorpe, Brigg, Barton, Crowle, Epworth, Ashby & Riddings.

name: Crowle Entertainers
description:
We are a community based drama group for ages 8 - 88 and above who meet in Crowle but open to anyone in the North Lincolnshire area. Members are involved at every stage from determining which production we do, from devising and improvising to creating the piece, acting, singing and dancing, creating the set and props to putting on a performance.   

We put on performances twice a year - a pantomime in January and a Summer production such as a Shakespeare play, comedy, murder mystery, local history etc. to help develop everyone's skills.  Many have stayed with us from eight to adulthood and have become part of the Crowle Entertainer's family. 

Anyone more interested in helping backstage than on stage is invited to contact us, particularly with regard to the pantomime.

​​​​​​​Having just successfully put on our Summer Production, the group has now decided which pantomime we are creating for 2025.   Drum roll please.................. Beauty and the Beasties is the favoured choice and we are currently improvising so that our wonderfully creative writer/director/producer can magic our efforts into a totally unique and hopefully magical pantomime.  We will be performing it on Saturday 11 and Sunday 12 January 2025.  

Anyone interested in joining the group should get in touch for a chat and come along to see one of our performances.  

**Please note, we do not meet every Monday, this is only when a production is being worked on.  Please contact us before you come along.**

name: Crowle Peatland Railway
description:
Crowle Peatland Railway is a heritage railway in North Lincolnshire created to preserve the history and heritage of the Humberhead Peatland Railway.

We run a 3ft gauge railway with a number of locomotives. We also have a cafe on site entirely run by volunteers.

We offer rides on the railway for a small charge to experience the history of the line first hand.

The railway is only open on certain days, please check out our website to see the next available dates.

Events - Crowle Peatland Railway

organization.name: Crowle Peatland Railway
organization.description:
The railway was formed to preserve the history and heritage of the Humberhead Peatlands, in particular the railways.

Peat has been extracted from the moors since at least medieval times. When large-scale peat extraction started in the 19th century a network of 3ft gauge horse-drawn railways was established. It was not until the 1950s/60s that locomotives started to take over from horses.

We have open days throughout the year from Easter with special openings at Halloween and Christmas.

Watch out for updates about our events on our website and Facebook page.

name: Crowle Walking Netball
description:
Walking netball is a slower, less bouncy version of the game we all loved in our youth. It's great fun, super for your health and every session is full of laughter, daftness and - maybe - just a little competitiveness. We are also very sociable, enjoying popping to the local cafe for a coffee after the weekly session and an occasional evening out

Whether you played attack or defence, or have never played before, we are an inclusive group who would love to welcome you to our Saturday sessions, 10am - 11am at Crowle Leisure Centre.

name: Crystal Healing North Lincolnshire
description:
Crystal Healing - Energy Healing for the Mind, Body and Soul

Crystal healing is a holistic and natural therapy that taps into the energetic power of crystals and how they affect the body and mind.

Crystal healing is an energy-based system. This means it is based on the belief that we are all made up of different energies and that when this becomes stagnant, unbalanced, or blocked, it can cause illness or dis - ease. The premise is that crystals help unblock, balance, and direct energy where it is most needed, gently supporting the body to heal in a therapeutic way.

Different types of crystals are thought to have different properties and energies. Just holding and being near these crystals is, therefore, thought to affect our own energies on a physical, spiritual, and emotional level.

Crystal healers have extensive knowledge of the different stones and how they affect us and are able to use them in healing sessions.

Crystal healing can be used for a huge range of different issues - physical, emotional, psychological, spiritual as well as attracting more of what you want including love, health, wealth and happiness.


It's important to note however,  that crystal healing should not be seen as a substitute for medical or psychological treatment but rather as a complementary practice that can be used alongside conventional therapies.

To book a session please contact Deborah on 07842 978437.

name: Cupcakes, Coffee & Chat
description:
A very friendly, sociable ‘pop up' coffee shop, with home made cakes, scones and biscuits.

There is also a selection of books to borrow, swap or purchase and often knitted items to peruse.

First Saturday of each month, 10am - 12pm

See www.kirtoninlindsey.com/cupcakescoffeeandchat for details

organization.name: kirtoninlindsey.com
organization.description:
kirtoninlindsey.com is a community website featuring information on all facilities, community groups, fitness classes and useful links in the area.

Kirton in Lindsey is a picturesque town in Lincolnshire and is situated approximately an hour’s drive from the cities of Leeds and Sheffield, and only 30 minutes from Lincoln.

name: Curly's Funetics (6-8 year olds)
description:
Funetics is a fun and inclusive kids' athletics programme.

Funetics is created by England Athletics to help 4-11 year old children across the country to learn, develop and practice running jumping and throwing skills all year around, for a healthy confident future.

6-8 year olds - 5:15-6pm

9-11 year olds - 6:15-7pm

Contact us for availability on the email address above.
pc_attendingAccess_additionalInfo: Please contact us via email for availibilty of places.

name: Curly's Funetics (9-11 year olds)
description:
Funetics is a fun and inclusive kids' athletics programme.

Funetics is created by England Athletics to help 4-11 year old children across the country to learn, develop and practice running jumping and throwing skills all year around, for a healthy confident future.

6-8 year olds - 5:15-6pm

9-11 year olds - 6:15-7pm

Contact us for availability on the email address above.

name: Curly's Track Friday
description:
Come along and join our Friday night track sessions.

Join us any time between 5-7pm.

Follow our suggested session or do your own thing.

A chance to train in a friendly and supportive environment.

Mental and physical benefits.

Pot hole and traffic free.

From 11 years of age and up (under 16's need adult supervision).

Email us for further information.

name: Cycle Hub - Training and Cycle Maintenance
description:
The North Lincolnshire R-evolution Cycle Hub is funded by the Community Renewable Fund via North Lincolnshire council.
​As well as its accredited training offer, the Cycle Hub also delivers cycle maintenance workshops and taster sessions, teaching people of all ages how to undertake basic cycle maintenance such as mending a chain or fixing punctures.

The team also offers Bike Libraries to groups, schools, businesses and communities, loaning cycles to people for pleasure, to improve fitness, health and wellbeing, or to access work, education or training. Our 'Dr Bike' sessions can be booked for community events, for businesses, schools, colleges and groups, providing basic cycle repairs by qualified cycle mechanics.

​In North Lincolnshire we take donated bikes, which, where possible, will be repaired by Cycle Hub Trainees. These can be donated at Normanby Hall Country Park during opening hours, and at the R-evolution Cycle Hub, Scunthorpe Central, Carlton Street, Scunthorpe between the hours of 9am and 4pm, Monday to Thursday only.

organization.name: R-evolution
organization.description:
As a charity, we aim to help people in our community to learn again, and to have the confidence to continue growing long after they leave us; moving on to further education, development, or long-term employment.  
Our South Bank operation includes:
- North East Lincolnshire Cycle Workshop - King Edward Street, Grimsby
- North Lincolnshire Cycle Hub - Scunthorpe Central, Church Square, Scunthorpe
- Normanby Hall Horticulture - Normanby Hall Country Park, Normanby, Near Scunthorpe

name: Dad's Together Group
description:
Dads group. Dads and children welcome to enjoy some free activities and have fun together. With surprise visits from the Scunthorpe United FC players. Running on Saturday mornings. Free drop in sessions, Study United FC within Glanford Park, for more information contact sarah.tipler@northlincs.gov.uk  

Sessions run on 2 Nov, 30 Nov, 21 Dec, 25 Jan, 15 Feb, 22 March, 12 April, 24 May, 28 June (2025)

organization.name: NL Family
organization.description: NL Family hubs - supporting families across North Lincolnshire

name: Dads and Kids Sessions
description:
Our Dad & Kids Gym Sessions are a unique opportunity for dads and their children to get active together in a supportive, fun, and energizing environment! These sessions are designed to strengthen not only muscles but also the bond between fathers and their kids through shared fitness activities.

In each 45-minute session, dads and kids will engage in a variety of exercises and games that promote teamwork, coordination, and fitness skills suitable for all levels. From strength-building exercises to playful challenges, our goal is to create a positive space where families can work out, laugh, and grow together.

These sessions are fully funded—no cost involved—so there’s no need to register. Just show up, join in, and enjoy quality time with your kids while building healthy habits that will last a lifetime!

organization.name: New Beginnings
organization.description:
New Beginnings Personal Training and Wellness Facility offer the highest quality services and treatments for mind, body and wellness.


Our services are provided by highly qualified personal trainers who are experts in their field and hand selected by the New Beginning's owner and founder, Stacey Greenfield. 


Feeling good is a complex issue. Health is at the heart of it, but psychology has a role to play as well, and we need to have that feeling of looking good.


New Beginnings brings together a range of services for mind, body and wellness to help our clients be fit and well inside and out. The best way to great health is to look after the whole body, not just the physical aspects but also the mental issues as well; as the saying goes "Healthy Body, Healthy Mind".


Looking after your health as a whole package is so important, yet it is something that far too many people sadly neglect.  Our range of services has been put together in such a way that many of them complement each other.


Our fully equipped personal training studio allows clients to work out in comfort and privacy. In addition this allows clients to also benefit from the expert advice of our personal trainers either with one-to-one support based on their individual goals or small group classes such as yoga.


Our New Beginnings founder is also qualified in nutrition and is available to put together the best possible programme to assist with weight loss, fitness issues and helping to create a health body. For those clients who have issues with food, we can assist with this. Helping you to create a more positive and healthier person both on the outside and as well as on the inside can give you the real boost of confidence that can be invaluable in both a professional and personal capacity. 

From counselling to life coaching, our highly professional team can help you to overcome whatever it is that is preventing you from achieving your goals.

name: Daisy Homecare
description:
Daisy Homecare is a brand new domiciliary care service* operating in and around North East Lincolnshire. 

We offer bespoke packages and a variety of services to suit your needs. If you or a loved one needs an extra helping hand, or day to day support, feel free to give us a call on 01472 472287 (Mon - Fri).

Our services include support with personal care, medication assistance, companionship, support with nutrition and hydration, social visits, domestic visits and shopping trips including medication collection.

Alternatively send us an email to hello@daisyhomecare.co.uk and one of our friendly members of staff will be on hand to help. 

*Daisy Homecare currently acts as an agency to provide individuals with the care they need, through our team of experienced and highly trained carers. All carers are DBS checked, self-insured and trained to the highest standard.
pc_attendingAccess_additionalInfo: Daily support in an individuals own home, supported by our team of trained and qualified care workers.

organization.name: Daisy Homecare
organization.description:
Daisy Home Care Ltd is a small, person-centred company provides a friendly and compassionate approach to your day-by-day needs, tailoring service to suit everybody and support independence in comfort own home as long as possible.

Care workers are chosen carefully to suits individual's needs, making sure they care for dignity and respect.

All carers have excellent training and support to provide best quality of care to Adults in need.

We are working around you, providing at least 30 minutes visits to make sure you are not rushed by our carers, to support you in a respectful and professional way, full of compassion and empathy.

name: Damn Tall Buildings
description:
“Bluegrass at heart, but pulling from a wide range of influences including swing, ragtime, jazz, and even a hint of contemporary perspective in the songwriting, they offer virtually unmatched energy and enthusiasm, underpinned by intelligent songs that don’t skimp on the infectiousness…” —Saving Country Music

Damn Tall Buildings are a folk-bluegrass band celebrated for their soulful melodies and intricate instrumentals. 

Fuelled by the musical prowess of Max Capistran, Sasha Dubyk, and Avery Ballotta, this seasoned Brooklyn-based trio, with 11 years of dedicated touring and recording experience, weaves heartfelt lyrics into a tapestry of masterful fiddle, guitar, banjo, and bass playing. 

Embodying a blend of Americana roots and contemporary finesse, Damn Tall Buildings’ musical journey transcends borders. 

From intimate local venues to global stages, their magnetic sound captivates audiences, leaving an indelible mark on the hearts of listeners worldwide.

“Damn Tall Buildings establishes their unique musical blend that defies both comparison and categorisation.” —No Depression

£15/£17 OTD

Tickets can be purchased via the Ropery Hall website, in person, or over the phone on 01652 660380

name: Daphne's Flight
description:
Chris While, Julie Matthews, Helen Watson, Melanie Harrold, Miranda Sykes.
Featuring five of the finest singer-songwriters of their generation, the music of Daphne’s Flight is a unique and magical blend of their individual styles, but together they create a unique and unparalleled force, empowering audiences of all ages, producing music that is relatable, moving and uplifting and creating a chemistry on stage that is both joyful and contagious.

Imagine, if you can, the instrumental sparkle and song writing creds of The Traveling Wilburys combined with the striking vocal prowess of Sweet Honey In The Rock. Then add the warmth and down-to-earth humour of The Derry Girls and you’ll be somewhere in Daphne’s territory. They create a unique sound and energy which unites singer-songwriter, folk, blues and more. Crossing a huge range of topics and genres, blending folk, blues, jazz and pop all woven together with striking harmonies and supported by a range of instrumentation and percussion. The music of Daphne’s Flight is a magical layering of sensitivity, beauty, experience and empowerment. Their songs are thought provoking, uplifting, empowering and relatable. They continue to inspire audiences with the warmth, energy and sheer joy they bring to their performances. They are, quite simply, a force to be reckoned with.

name: David Ramirez
description:
David Ramirez took a little time to get back to himself, and now he’s dead set on making music for himself—for the sake of the music… and nothing else.  

The Austin, Texas based singer-songwriter—whose decades-long career has seen six full length studio albums, three EPs, countless collaborations, and an illustrious supergroup project in Glorietta—spent a season of rest away from his focus on writing songs. David’s new record All the Not So Gentle Reminders, which comes out March 21, 2025 via Blue Corn Music is exactly what he was waiting for. The 12-song album is an expansive succession of dreamlike songs that tell his stories, yes—but more than anything lean into the possibilities of the trip that music can take us on.

name: Day Centre for the Homeless
description: As more and more people are pushed into homelessness our day centre provides them with a safe place to find solutions. At the Forge Project we recognise that too many people are lost in the system, so we offer multiple options to help them find a path out of homelessness. We offer a range of support including meals, shower or laundry facilities and clean clothing. We have support workers on hand to enable people to access specialist services like housing, work or mental health support. We do this because we recognise everyone has a right to lead a happy and healthy life.

name: Debt Advice Foundation
description:
Free, confidential debt advice from a UK charity

Debt Advice Foundation is a registered national debt advice and education charity offering free, confidential support and advice to anyone worried about loans, credit and debt.

Because we’re a debt charity, you can be sure that the advice we provide is impartial and based solely on what is best for you.

If you need to talk to someone in confidence about your options, there’s no need to wait or book an appointment, our free debt advice helpline is open Monday to Friday 8am to 6pm on 0800 043 40 50.

Support includes:

Cost of Living Support
Find out more about the financial support that is available to UK households to help ease the cost of living crisis.

Fraud Alert

Debt Advice Foundation will only ever call you if you request a call from us. Read more about what to do if you receive an unsolicited call here.

Find out more

How we help

If you have a debt problem, Debt Advice Foundation can help you understand which options are available to you and will recommend the debt solution that is right for your situation. Our aim is to help you regain control of your finances by:

  • Reducing monthly payments to a realistic and affordable level.
  • Stopping creditors taking enforcement action against you.
  • Protecting important assets such as your home.

If you are struggling to keep up with credit card, loan or debt consolidation repayments, have arrears or are facing legal action from lenders as a result of being unable to repay your unsecured or secured debts, our debt helpline advisors are standing by waiting to help.

Visit the website for full details of how the organisation can help you, or alternatively call the helpline above for advice and support.

organization.name: Debt Advice Foundation
organization.description: A specialist debt charity offering free, confidential advice on any aspect of debt.

name: Delta
description:
If you are a young person, DELTA provides outreach services for children and young people aged up to 19 affected by their own or their parent’s drug or alcohol use. It offers telephone support, home visits and individual counselling as well as advice and information on alcohol and related issues. 

Please call or visit the website for more information.

organization.name: We Are With You
organization.description: Get free, confidential support with alcohol, drugs or mental health from one of our local services or online

name: Dementia Cafe - Ashby
description: Come along to our friendly Dementia Cafes. Run by our Dementia Advisors. Come along for a cuppa and a chat, along with a range of activities for those living with dementia and their Carers.

organization.name: Carers' Support Service
organization.description: The Carers’ Support Centre is a charity that has been supporting Carers for nearly 30 years. We are here to work with Carers to ensure they receive the right support and information at the right time, enabling them to continue looking after members of their family, friends and neighbours.

description: Come along to our friendly Dementia Cafes. Run by our Dementia Advisors. Come along for a cuppa and a chat, along with a range of activities for those living with dementia and their Carers.

description:
Come along to our friendly Dementia Cafes. Run by our Dementia Advisors. Come along for a cuppa and a chat, along with a range of activities for those living with dementia and their Carers. 

Please note - a different date may be set when this session falls on a bank holiday. Please call 01652 650585 for further information.

name: Dementia Carer Peer Support Group
description:
Carer Peer Support Groups can offer empathetic support that only another Carer can give. They are a great way to meet other Carers, socialise, develop friendships and share information.

Dementia Carers meet on the second Wednesday of every month from 2pm to 3:30pm at the Ashby Community Hub and you will be made very welcome.

Talk to us if you feel you cannot attend because of your caring role on 01652 650585 or email info@carerssupportcentre.com.

organization.name: Carers' Support Service
organization.description: The Carers’ Support Centre is a charity that has been supporting Carers for nearly 30 years. We are here to work with Carers to ensure they receive the right support and information at the right time, enabling them to continue looking after members of their family, friends and neighbours.

name: Dementia Direct
description:
Dementia Direct is the home of support for people living with Dementia and their Carers. 

If you are living with Dementia we offer the following:

- one to one support over the phone, online or face to face with a trained Dementia Advisor.

- a focus on your wellbeing rather than the condition.

- support you around understanding the condition, and navigating the social care support available.

- advice and workshops on planning for the future.

- local support groups across North Lincolnshire


If you are supporting someone living with Dementia we have the following support:

- Understanding Dementia workshops giving you the knowledge and understanding to help you manage your role.

- Training including stress management, wellbeing, falls awareness, legal matters, planning for the future.

- Activities designed to give you a break from your caring role.

- Peer support groups so you can meet other Carers

- Emotional support you help you deal with difficult emotions.

organization.name: Dementia Direct
organization.description:
The Carers ' Support Service is the commissioned service for the provision of support for people living with Dementia. We have been supporting Carers of people living with Dementia since 1989. Support is now all in one place.
Dementia Direct provides information, advice and guidance. We help people living with Dementia, their family and Carers to cope with and manage their journey through Dementia.
Support for people living with Dementia.
•	One-to-one support over the phone, online or face-to-face with a trained advisor.  
•	A focus on wellbeing rather than illness. 
•	Support to help come to terms with and live well with Dementia 
•	Assistance with the health and social care support 
•	Advice and workshops 
•	Local support groups 
•	Signposting to appropriate support as Dementia progresses 

Dementia Support for family members and Carers
•	Understanding Dementia Workshops that help Carers to cope with and manage their caring role. 
•	Training, including stress management, legal matters (including LPA), planning for the future, and more 
•	Activities designed to give Carers a break 
•	Peer support groups 
•	Emotional support 
•	Support through crisis

name: Dementia support
description:
Alzheimer's Society offers a range of support services. From a listening ear on the phone to a visit in person and opportunities to connect with others.

We'll be there for you again and again and again, no matter what.

A Dementia support service is specific to each person's needs and is decided in agreement with them.

The service provides one to one support to people with dementia and carers and can be provided face to face, over the telephone or via written communication.

Dementia Support Workers provide information, guidance and practical support to help people understand dementia, cope with day to day living with dementia and prepare for the future.

The service also supports people to access other services. 

Dementia support

Call: 0333 150 3456

If you are affected by dementia, worried about a diagnosis or a carer, trained staff are ready to give you the support you need.

Opening hours: Mon to Weds: 9am – 8pm, Thurs and Fri: 9am – 5pm, Sat and Sun: 10am – 4pm

For support in your area please visit: Find support near you | Alzheimer's Society (alzheimers.org.uk)

name: Digital Drop In
description:
A helpful, informative computer session which is useful for those getting to grips with learning to use a computer, laptop or other device. 

Get help with your digital device from our friendly volunteers. No need to book, just call in.

Don't forget to bring your own device and if you require help downloading apps from the app store, don't forget your Apple ID and password if you own an Apple device.

name: Dinky Dancers
description:
Classes for your Dinky Dancer are for independent children, aged 4-6 years. 

We extend the work covered in the Teeny Bopper classes so you know that your child is learning through a proven system to help increase their confidence and express their creativity.

organization.name: The Music and Dance Journey
organization.description: The Music & Dance Journey in Kirton-in-Lindsey is the most comprehensive music and dance studio in the North Lincolnshire area. We have classes on offer for students from ages 18 months to 99 (although there’s really no upper age limit – you’re as young as you feel). Our studio is accredited with the Council for Dance, Drama and Musical Theatre (CDMT). To ensure dance classes are suitable for those who attend, we offer a range of options split into age groups for children and different levels of ability for adults. Whether you are aiming for a professional career, looking to stay fit or finally ready to give dance a try, we have a class for you. For music lessons, we offer a range of different instruments and offer comprehensive guidance as to which one may suit you best. The teachers at The Music & Dance Journey have a vast range of experience across disciplines. Our collective approach is to share our love of music and dance while being supportive and encouraging. Enrol for group lessons or book private lessons at a time that suits you.

name: Do Something Different - Active Circuits
description:
Come along and try our ‘Do Something Different’ sport, leisure and cultural sessions specifically for adults with a disability aged 16 and above. Have fun, meet new people and learn new skills. Activities include rebound therapy, archery, table tennis, boccia and multi sports. To find out more call 01724 297270 or email community.recreation@northlincs.gov.uk.

Our Do Something Different video shows some of our previous activities and what people think to them.

organization.name: NLActive
organization.description: North Lincolnshire Council manages a number of NLActive centres and sports facilities across North Lincolnshire. Some facilities are located on hub sites so the public can access multiple services at one location. NLActive also runs a community outreach programme and works with local communities to enable them to find a way to help their residents lead a more active lifestyle.

name: Domiciliary Care
description:
Amara Care Limited has been providing consultation, therapy, residential services and domiciliary care services for individuals with a range of support requirements, since November 2003. This has included supporting both children and adults with learning disabilities, physical disabilities, mental health conditions and other accompanying emotional/complex needs, as well as elderly and frail clients, and those living with Dementia.

The ultimate aim of Amara Care is to provide a meaningful life for the people we support.

organization.name: Amara Care
organization.description:
Amara Care is an established family-run domiciliary care provider based throughout North Lincolnshire and Lincolnshire. 

Amara Care Limited provides domiciliary care consultation, therapy, residential services, facilities and services for, and on behalf of, people who have learning disabilities, physical disabilities, mental health conditions and accompanying emotional needs, living in their own homes.

name: Dramarama

Through Drama activities, role play, improvisations, we learn more about the world around us while team bonding, building confidence and learning acting techniques. We can study scripts and even put on a play if you wish to!

The time and place is up to you, subject to availability of course.

name: Emotional / Trauma Release Therapy (energy healing)
description:
Emogic offers the facilitation of emotional release from the very root core of its existence. Unlike traditional talk therapies we don't need to drag up the past, we find the emotion, energy or trauma that is causing dis-ease in the body or mind and release it. Emogic is suitable for any ages, for many different issues from PTSD, Migraines, Panic attacks, Fibromyalgia and any dis-ease you are experiencing. 

It is a therapy like no other, with absolutely amazing results. If you are ready to heal from your past then get in touch, a free consultation is offered if you are unsure. However, if you would like to book in we ask for a £10 booking fee and if you don't feel like paying the rest then no need. We want to help as many people as possible on their healing journey rich or poor. 

Sessions are booked by appointment only - please contact to book. 

Face to face or online/virtual sessions available.

organization.name: Emogic
organization.description:
Lilli King
Light worker and Healer

Our subconscious mind is there to protect us but not always in the way that we desire.

I have learnt a technique that uses the subconscious mind to release emotions that have been stored in the body, this may be from:

* passed experiences/traumas where emotions haven’t been fully felt or worked through,

*passed down from parents/ancestors,

*or even absorbed from someone else.

When these emotions are left in the body, they can cloud your mind and judgement or even cause pain and issues within your body.

Unknowingly this was the case for myself, upon using this technique firstly with the help of my sister then being able to do it on myself i have cured some issues that I had been suffering from for over 10 years. One of these being non-epileptic seizures.

When we hold onto these emotions, (whether aware of the fact or not) they can lead to many mental issues such as anxiety, panic attacks, fears, nightmares, relationship problems, or blockages in life.

Once released through a simple technique you will feel lighter and more yourself!

organization.name: Epworth Equestrian parkrun
organization.description:
What is Epworth Equestrian parkrun?
A free, fun, and friendly weekly 5k community event. Walk, jog, run, volunteer or spectate – it's up to you!

When is it?
Every Saturday at 9:00am.

Where is it?
The event takes place at Epworth Equestrian Centre, Scawcett Lane, Epworth, DN9 1LQ. See Course page for more details.

What does it cost to join in?
Nothing - it's free! but please register before you first come along. Only ever register with parkrun once and don't forget to bring a scannable copy of your barcode (request a reminder). If you forget it, you won't get a time.

How fast do I have to be?
We all take part for our own enjoyment. Please come along and join in whatever your pace!
