name: Social Walks
description:
Our social walks are free volunteer led walks ranging mostly from one to three miles in distance.

All of the walks are led and supported by at least two trained walk leaders, (one with first aid equipment). Everybody is welcome to join any of the walks. There is no need to book prior to your walk. Simply turn up on the day and find one of the walk leaders (they will be wearing a high visibility vest).

  • Please wear comfortable shoes with grip and be aware that some walks may be muddy in places. It is also advisable to bring a drink with you, particularly in warmer weather.
  • Please consider residents and other road users when parking and allow adequate room for farming vehicles. Please do not park on verges, block driveways and always consider the Highway Code when parking.
  • Assistance dogs are welcome on walks.
  • In severe weather conditions, walks may be cancelled. Please call 01724 298087 before 9.30am on the day of the walk if you are in any doubt that a walk will be taking place.
  • If you are attending for the first time, please arrive 10-15 minutes earlier than the noted start time to complete a short registration form.

Please visit our website https://www.northlincs.gov.uk/walking to find the latest walks near you or sign up to receive our quarterly programmes.

organization.name: Walking North Lincolnshire
organization.description:
The Walking the Way to Health Initiative in North Lincolnshire currently has led walks that are being run all over the county. All led walks are free and most are no longer than three miles each.

All of the walks are led and supported by at least two trained walk leaders, one with first aid equipment. Everybody is welcome to join any of the walks. There is no need to book, just turn up on the day and find one of the walk leaders (they will be wearing a high visibility vest).

name: South Killingholme Fun and Flex
description:
Our 30 minute modified strength and balance exercises are designed to help improve posture, strengthen muscles, boost mood and energy levels whilst helping to regain fitness at your own pace.  Fun and Flex is just what is needed for those of you who want to improve your flexibility and balance and improve your mental wellbeing, helping you to relax and de-stress.

Fun and Flex will restart on alternate Wednesdays as from 28 November, with teas/coffees afterwards.

organization.name: Oikos Brigg
organization.description:
Oikos is a Greek word which literally translates to English as House, but more accurately - Home.  A place where you can be yourself, be fed, cared for and listened to.

Oikos - Brigg is a town centre shop with a difference! A unique not-for-profit charity established so that Christians of all denominations and none can work together to provide love and practical support for local families.

We strive to be a friendly, caring community where everyone is welcome and valued.

Put simply, our vision is to support our local community and as followers of Jesus, grow together, in faith, in hope and in love.

name: Squash & Racketball
description:
A warm and welcoming environment for people to play squash and racketball for all ages and abilities at an easy access town centre location (behind Pods)

Four well-maintained LED-lit and heated courts (one with a glass back) for squash or racketball

Adult, joint, student and junior memberships starting from just £14/month

Adult and junior coaching available with two fully qualified England Squash Level 2 coaches (cost to be agreed)

Online bookable time slots available 7 days a week between 8am and 10pm

Free taster sessions are available

organization.name: Scunthorpe Squash
organization.description:
We are a very friendly club providing everything to do with Squash and Racketball at a really reasonable cost, the club welcomes new players at any level with coaching opportunities available for those who wish to improve or generally want to learn with a qualified coach.


Free sessions with equipment provided can be arranged for anyone wanting to try Squash, to view our memberships or, if you are already a member and wish to book a court, click on the text or use the menu at the top of the page.

Memberships are available on request and start from only £2 per week! Please visit our sign up page to register or for more information, contact information, questions and queries.

The courts are well maintained and cleaned on a regular basis to ensure a safe and clean environment; we adhere to all guidelines and make sure the courts are always to our standards.


Box Leagues are very popular and a great way to meet other players of a same level with many players progressing to play in one of the many Team Leagues, Mini Leagues or Competitions we organise at the club:

name: Starlight Arts - Arts and Crafts
description:
Starlight Arts provides opportunities for disabled adults (16+) to engage with music therapy, Makaton, drama, disability dance, life and social skills, arts and crafts and Lego® therapy.

Our arts and crafts groups offer a range of crafts, drawing and painting techniques for disabled adults (16+).

The sessions run monthly (term time only) on Fridays 10am - 12pm and/or 1pm - 3pm the option to stay for both if required.

Contact us to book for a taster session.

Starlight Arts provides opportunities for disabled adults to engage with music therapy, Makaton, drama, disability dance, life and social skills, arts and crafts and Lego® therapy. We provide opportunities for adults who are often overlooked in society for them to shine and gain confidence through the use of projects in the community, breaking down stereotypes within society. Our focus is on integrating our arts projects within the local community and this is important to us as a key value of Starlight Arts. Starlight Arts allows adults with disabilities to learn new skills, opening new doors to further opportunities.

  • Improves mental health and wellbeing
  • Promotes community engagement and cohesion
  • Provides routes for success
  • Increases happiness
  • Promotes positive behaviour that increases positive social interactions
  • Promotes appropriate mediums for emotional expression
  • Allows for knowledge sharing
  • Creates opportunity for communication
  • Builds confidence and self esteem

organization.name: Connect Church
organization.description:
Connect Church is a new expression with a significant heritage.

Though we launched as a brand new and distinct church in 2020, our history actually goes back more than 100 years.

On 13th November 1920 a church service was held in an old YMCA building on Scunthorpe High Street and a new faith community was born. After a few moves and a temporary closure during the Second World War, the community known as Scunthorpe Baptist Church found its home on Ashby Road.

Almost exactly a century after that first service the members of the church made the audacious and bold decision to close and reopen as ‘Connect Church’; a new venture built from the ground up to meet the challenges and opportunities of the 21st Century world.

name: Step Aerobics Class
description:
Step Aerobics

This is the classic workout class done on a step.  A class will target your legs and core and will improve your balance and agility. The moves are broken down and easy to follow and done to music usually from the 80’s.

organization.name: Sue Wakefield Fitness
organization.description:
I have been teaching different classes at many different gyms, fitness centres and other venues for over 35 years now. I started fitness quite late on in life doing the initial training with my daughter as she didn’t want to do it on her own and from then on I was hooked and have never looked back.

Well firstly my participants are my priority and I understand that to enjoy a class you need to feel welcome and safe; you need to know its ok if the class is moving in one direction and you’re going in the other its fine. Everybody does it so you’re not the first and won’t be the last.

I think my classes have been popular for so many years is because they are fun, hey even I go wrong but we can laugh about it.

Its important you work at a level that feels good for you and you are in an environment that allows this.

I know there are barriers to fitness for many people but hopefully the classes can help remove some of those for you and leave you feeling empowered and crush any doubts you may had about yourself and abilities.

name: Steve Tilston
description:
Steve Tilston is one of our most celebrated songsmiths, widely recognised within the world of folk and contemporary music; the words, arrangements and subtle, quite superb guitar playing could be no one else.

The story of Steve’s “lost” letter from John Lennon thrust Steve into the worldwide media spotlight and was the inspiration for a Hollywood movie. Danny Collins, starring Al Pacino in the title role is now available to own on DVD. Sadly, Steve’s songs didn’t actually appear on the soundtrack, but the publicity surrounding the film, brought Steve and his music to much wider attention.

Though known as a songwriter, Steve has always had an ear for the tradition and included new interpretations of old favourites on his original recordings.

“The more you listen, the more there is to discover.” Bob Harris

£15/£17 OTD

Tickets can be purchased via the Ropery Hall website, in person, or over the phone on 01652 660380

name: Stick and Splodge (Term Time Only)
description:
Art, crafts and sensory play for under 5's. No need to book.

Every Thursday in Term Time.

organization.name: 20-21 Visual Arts Centre
organization.description:
About 20-21
Welcome to 20-21 Visual Arts Centre
The entrance to 20-21 Visual Arts Centre
20-21 Visual Arts Centre is housed in the former St. John’s Church building in Church Square, Scunthorpe. Since the gallery’s doors first opened in 2001 we have developed a reputation for offering a varied and exciting exhibition programme of contemporary art, craft and design.  We show around 20 exhibitions per year, across six exhibition spaces, and aim to be as ambitious and creatively diverse.  As well as bringing arts and culture to the local community, we aim to exhibit art by groups that are traditionally under represented in mainstream galleries.

Encompassing a wide range of media, subjects and artistic approaches, we present a mixture of in-house curated exhibitions, touring shows and exhibitions developed in partnership with fellow creative organisations.  We also produce and deliver our own touring exhibitions to other galleries nationally, and offer an extensive education programme for all ages and abilities.

We’re an Arts Council England [National Portfolio Organisation (NPO] which means funding thanks to tax payers and National Lottery players plays a huge part in supporting our work.

name: Stop Smoking Support - Healthy Lifestyles
description:
Our 6-week Stop Shops offer a combination of behavioural support alongside providing nicotine replacement therapy in our face-to-face group format. The free nicotine replacement products are only available for your first 4 weeks with our team; however, we can provide behavioural support for a total of 6-weeks.  After an initial assessment, our facilitators will encourage and support you to set a quit date, once this date is set, with our support, you are expected to work towards the commitment of not taking a single puff of a cigarette. This service aims to help to work towards a total quit status and is not tailored to those who are wanting to cut down.

Our Stop Shops offer guidance in a friendly, supportive environment where peer support is encouraged and utilised to create an atmospheric, accessible, and enjoyable experience to help you go smoke-free. 

If you feel you're ready to stop smoking and could benefit from our team's support. You can self refer into our team using the link below, all you need to do is fill in a few details and one of our facilitators will be in touch.

https://www.elementalsoftware.site/north-linconshire/self-refer

Appointments for our Stop Smoking Support are available by bookable appointment only and bookings can be made via telephone during the times specified:

Monday-Thursday: 9am - 5pm

Friday: 9am - 4.30pm

organization.name: North Lincolnshire Healthy Lifestyles
organization.description:
The North Lincolnshire Healthy Lifestyle team brings together lifestyle support services in one place. This makes it easier for local people to access help and support for a range of issues at once.

You can access the team at local venues such as leisure centres, community hubs, and some GP practices.

Our friendly healthy lifestyle facilitators can support you with:

achieving and maintaining a healthy weight
stopping smoking
reducing alcohol use
signposting to wider local supporting services
Our service is available via self referrals or referrals made through your GP practice.

name: Street Dance
description:
FREE street dance sessions In Epworth and Scunthorpe open to young people aged between 8 and 18 years old (or age 25 for people with a disability).

The sessions are led by qualified coaches from StreetBeat. 

A signed parental consent form is required prior to taking part in your first session.

NLActive also runs a community outreach programme and works with local communities to enable them to find a way to help their residents lead a more active lifestyle.

description:

This Street Sport sessions is Girls Football. Follow our latest updates on our Street Sport Facebook page

A signed parental consent form is required prior to taking part in your first session of Street Sport or On Target.

name: Stroke Association - Stroke Recovery Service and Communication Support
description:
The Stroke Association Recovery Service provides support and practical information to people who have had a stroke and their families and carers.  We help families prepare for the changes that happen because of a stroke and help them to cope both physically and emotionally.  The service can also help people who live alone.

The service can offer:
-support for stroke survivors and their carers
-information to help people understand the effects of stroke
-advice and support to make healthier lifestyle choices to help prevent further strokes
-signposting to relevant providers of care to meet family needs
-advocacy support and advice on how to get help from health services, social services and voluntary organisations
-access to carer support groups and stroke clubs
-support for those with communication difficulties

The Stroke Association Support Co-Ordinator will contact the person who has had a stroke and their family/carer following their discharge.  They will also keep in touch with families by phone, email, WhatsApp, Zoom and/or face to face.

organization.name: Stroke Association
organization.description: We are the UK’s leading stroke charity. We deliver stroke services across the UK, campaign for better stroke care, invest in research and fundraise to expand our reach to as many stroke survivors as possible.

name: Support For Vegans
description:
The Vegan Society works to help more people become vegan with confidence, encourage more trusted Vegan Society Trademarked products to be available in shops, and take veganism to the mainstream. It provides information and guidance on various aspects of veganism for new and potential vegans, caterers, healthcare professionals, educators and the media. It also co-ordinates a variety of campaigns to raise awareness of the lifestyle.

The Vegan Society runs a mentoring scheme to help people who would like to become vegan called the Vegan Pledge. The number of Pledgers has doubled in the last year, with over 1000 people taking the Pledge each month.

Our multi-disciplinary Research Committee consists of over 25 academics pursuing research on a range of topics within veganism. Please let us know if you wish to speak to a specialist and we will recommend someone.

The Vegan Society is the oldest vegan organisation in the world and was founded in 1944. At the establishment of the Society, founder Donald Watson and his wife coined the term ‘vegan’ to describe the lifestyle of what were then called the non-dairy vegetarians. The word ‘vegan’ was created from the first and last letters of ‘vegetarian’.

We have a huge range of information and support for free via our website.

In addition, everyone is welcome to join The Vegan Society as a member; we are not exclusive to committed vegans. So, whether you are vegan, vegetarian, following a plant-based diet or just curious, The Vegan Society is here to support you on your journey.

We will advise you on different vegan food and products to try and keep you up to date with the latest news. Access to our in-house dietitians, along with nutritional guidance on how to make the most of a vegan diet at your fingertips. You will also find expert knowledge on some of the most popular topics relating to vegan health and food.

organization.name: The Vegan Society
organization.description:
There are many ways to embrace vegan living. Yet one thing all vegans have in common is a plant-based diet avoiding all animal foods such as meat (including fish, shellfish and insects), dairy, eggs and honey - as well as avoiding animal-derived materials, products tested on animals and places that use animals for entertainment.

Some people may choose to go vegan, for some it may be because they do not believe in farmed animal practices and animal exploitation, for others it may be due to environmental concerns. Whatever the reason The Vegan Society is here to support everyone on their vegan journey.

name: Supported Lodgings
description:
The supported lodgings scheme is designed to provide a stepping-stone for young people aged 16-24, on their route to independence.

Through Supported Lodgings young people can gain advice and support from a caring adult. This allows them to move confidently into independent living as and when they feel prepared. Some individuals may be care leavers and for others it may be impossible to return to the family home. The aim is to provide them with a comfortable room within a safe environment where they can develop the everyday life skills that they may not have previously experienced.

You can find out more and watch our new supported lodgings video on the North Lincolnshire Council website here: https://www.northlincs.gov.uk/people-health-and-care/supported-lodgings/

name: Swap to Stop Incentive
description:
Want to stop smoking? Not sure how? Need gentle encouragement and support to help you? Then this is the session for you. 

Please contact Victor House for more information.

organization.name: Victor House
organization.description:
Victor House Is a Safe Hub offering vital support to people who are homeless or at risk of homelessness. Victor House opens seven days a week, including Christmas Day 2-6pm and Boxing Day 8-10pm providing hot drinks  and donations of food are provided when available, essential support services are offered based upon, strength based conversations and care & support needs identified. 
Showering/laundry facilities are also available.

Night Provision is available and this is based on visitors completing a form daily - with support - from the team at Victor House in order for application to be considered based on priority need.

name: Switcheroo
description:
Clap Trap Theatre in association with York Theatre Royal

When it comes to scattering their mother’s ashes, three siblings are hit with a bombshell revelation that turns their world upside down
This remarkable play is based on the very simple premise that ‘it’s not what you say, it’s the way that you say it’.
The first act is a full-blown, larger than life comedy. Then, after the interval, the actors swap characters and it’s repeated as a serious drama. 
The difference between the two Acts is astonishing. 
How can the same story, performed by the same actors, saying the same words be so different? There is only one way to find out…

name: Table Top Games
description:
Do you have some free time to fill and enjoy company of others? Do you like to play board games? Why not join us at our friendly group at Ashby Community Hub on Tuesday's 1.30pm-3pm. We have a variety of games such as dominoes, cards, scrabble and rummikub.

It is a great opportunity to check out the large choice of books available in the library whilst you are there, and other information too.

Free to attend, no need to book. Refreshments provided. Look forward to welcoming you there.

organization.name: Community Wellbeing
organization.description: The aim of the Community Wellbeing team is to reduce social isolation, empower community groups and reconnect communities

name: Tai Chi
description:
Tai Chi is an Ancient Chinese tradition practiced for health-giving benefits as a graceful form of non-competitive, gentle, and generally slow paced exercise.  Tai Chi may be beneficial in improving balance, health and wellbeing.  So if you want to improve your strength, reduce stress and anxiety then Tai Chi is for you.

Please check the website for all details : https://www.kirtoninlindsey.com/taichi

organization.name: kirtoninlindsey.com
organization.description:
kirtoninlindsey.com is a community website featuring information on all facilities, community groups, fitness classes and useful links in the area.

Kirton in Lindsey is a picturesque town in Lincolnshire and is situated approximately an hour’s drive from the cities of Leeds and Sheffield, and only 30 minutes from Lincoln.

name: Taiji
description: Please contact George on 07734 762059 for more details and check out the website: https://www.kirtoninlindsey.com/taiji

name: Talking News Paper
description: A fortnightly audio newspaper

name: Tara MacLean
description: Tara MacLean from Prince Edward Island Canada, has been captivating audiences around the world for over 25 years with her soulful voice and poignant songwriting.  She can silence a room with her powerful sensual voice or by letting some of her enamoured charm out on each person she meets.  For more information visit www.townhalllive.co.uk

organization.name: Town Hall Live Kirton in Lindsey
organization.description: Bringing you the best of UK and Trans-Atlantic folk and roots music. Browse or search our events below to find out more about what’s happening at Town Hall Live. For more information on the artists please click their name. To reserve tickets call Brian Chudley: 01652 649230 or you can purchase tickets through this link https://www.wegottickets.com/kirtontownhall

name: Tatterfoals Morris
description:
We are a group of Morris dancers and musicians who get together weekly to practice for our performances throughout the year.

We work towards morris performances that take place throughout North Lincolnshire and sometimes further afield.

Costumes will all be provided as and when needed for events we will attend

Come along and meet us, we are a friendly bunch who would welcome anyone to a practice to see if you would like to join our group on a more permanent basis.

We meet at St Hugh's Church Hall on a Thursday evening 7.30pm - 9pm, although some weeks due to low numbers we may not meet.  Please always email to check we will be there before making your journey.

organization.name: Tatterfoals
organization.description:
We are a Morris Dancing and Musicians group who get together for weekly practices at St Hugh's Church Hall to keep alive the tradition of morris.

We welcome both dancers and musicians from any background and gender who would like to join us.

We put on performances around the area at local events and further afield.

name: Tea and Toast
description:
A time to chat to other parents and guardians about parenting stories. Pre-school children welcome.

Enjoy a cuppa, meet other parents and our family hub staff. Discuss difficulties or concerns you may have or gain skills and advice while meeting new people and sharing stories. All children must be accompanied by a responsible adult.

No booking required, just drop in.

organization.name: NL Family
organization.description: NL Family hubs - supporting families across North Lincolnshire

name: Tea Dance
description:
Imagine you're dancing around Blackpool Tower Ballroom along with the Strictly contestants....

Ok, so we're in Scunthorpe, but you're more than welcome to put on your dancing shoes and join other dancers here at Central Community Centre every Friday at 1pm to dance many different dancing styles.  Some weeks also have an organist playing for you to dance to.

Partners are not always necessary, plenty of people come along on their own and still enjoy the afternoon.  Some of the wonderful participants will help to show you the dance moves to certain dances you are not sure of.

These sessions are £3 each.

organization.name: Central Community Centre
organization.description: Central Community Centre is a hub of activity in the centre of Scunthorpe with a community cafe and rooms available to hire along with many regular groups and activities taking place throughout the week.

name: Teen Health and Hijabs
description:
Our Teen Health and Hijab sessions are specially designed fitness classes for teenage Muslim girls aged 11-16, providing a culturally sensitive space for exercise and wellness. These sessions are led by female trainers who create a comfortable environment for young women to engage in physical fitness while respecting their cultural values. Each session offers a mix of exercises, including strength training, cardio, and flexibility, tailored to help participants develop strength, endurance, and confidence.

Alongside fitness, Teen Health and Hijab sessions also emphasize health education, empowering young women with knowledge about fitness, nutrition, and overall wellness. With a focus on building a supportive community, these sessions aim to create a positive space where participants can connect with others who understand their unique needs and experiences. Teen Health and Hijab is about embracing fitness in a way that aligns with personal and cultural values, fostering both physical health and a sense of belonging.

FULLY FUNDED

organization.name: New Beginnings
organization.description:
New Beginnings Personal Training and Wellness Facility offer the highest quality services and treatments for mind, body and wellness.


Our services are provided by highly qualified personal trainers who are experts in their field and hand selected by the New Beginning's owner and founder, Stacey Greenfield. 


Feeling good is a complex issue. Health is at the heart of it, but psychology has a role to play as well, and we need to have that feeling of looking good.


New Beginnings brings together a range of services for mind, body and wellness to help our clients be fit and well inside and out. The best way to great health is to look after the whole body, not just the physical aspects but also the mental issues as well; as the saying goes "Healthy Body, Healthy Mind".


Looking after your health as a whole package is so important, yet it is something that far too many people sadly neglect.  Our range of services has been put together in such a way that many of them complement each other.


Our fully equipped personal training studio allows clients to work out in comfort and privacy. In addition this allows clients to also benefit from the expert advice of our personal trainers either with one-to-one support based on their individual goals or small group classes such as yoga.


Our New Beginnings founder is also qualified in nutrition and is available to put together the best possible programme to assist with weight loss, fitness issues and helping to create a health body. For those clients who have issues with food, we can assist with this. Helping you to create a more positive and healthier person both on the outside and as well as on the inside can give you the real boost of confidence that can be invaluable in both a professional and personal capacity. 

From counselling to life coaching, our highly professional team can help you to overcome whatever it is that is preventing you from achieving your goals.

name: Teen The MoveMENt
description:
Gym and Fitness Environment for male teens in year 7 to year 11.

The aim of these group workouts are to:

Enhance motor skills & better movement

Increase strength and conditioning that translates to all sports

Goal-setting and attainment through self-discipline

Lifelong love of physical activity and fitness

Positive body image

Better understanding of health, fitness and nutrition

Reversal of health issues such as obesity

Protection against injury

Increase self-confidence and self-worth

Supportive, positive community of teens and adult role models

Improved life skills such as problem solving, perseverance, and dedication

Sessions are on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 3.45pm till 4.30pm FULLY FUNDED at New Beginnings Personal Training and Wellness Facility.

organization.description:
New Beginnings Personal Training and Wellness Facility offer the highest quality services and treatments for mind, body and wellness.


Our services are provided by highly qualified personal trainers who are experts in their field and hand selected by the New Beginning's owner and founder, Stacey Greenfield.

name: Teeny Boppers
description: Classes for your Teeny Bopper are for pre-school children, aged 3-5 years, either new to our children’s dance journey, or progressing from the Melody & Milligan Bear classes, but still requiring the support of their parent/guardian.
pc_attendingAccess_additionalInfo: This class is for children and their parent

organization.name: The Music and Dance Journey
organization.description: The Music & Dance Journey in Kirton-in-Lindsey is the most comprehensive music and dance studio in the North Lincolnshire area. We have classes on offer for students from ages 18 months to 99 (although there’s really no upper age limit – you’re as young as you feel). Our studio is accredited with the Council for Dance, Drama and Musical Theatre (CDMT). To ensure dance classes are suitable for those who attend, we offer a range of options split into age groups for children and different levels of ability for adults. Whether you are aiming for a professional career, looking to stay fit or finally ready to give dance a try, we have a class for you. For music lessons, we offer a range of different instruments and offer comprehensive guidance as to which one may suit you best. The teachers at The Music & Dance Journey have a vast range of experience across disciplines. Our collective approach is to share our love of music and dance while being supportive and encouraging. Enrol for group lessons or book private lessons at a time that suits you.

name: Tennis Club
description:
The App Frod Tennis Club is the only tennis club in the Scunthorpe Borough and is based at the Brumby Hall Sports Ground behind the Pods on Ashby Road. Club nights are on Tuesday and Thursday evenings from 5pm. The club has three floodlit hard courts and, in the summer months, three grass courts.

Please visit for more information or contact using the details above - new members very welcome.

organization.name: Appleby Frodingham Tennis Club
organization.description:
The Tennis Club is based at the Brumby Hall Sports ground behind The Pods on Ashby Road in Scunthorpe, DN16 1AA.

We have 3 grass courts, 6 floodlit hard courts and a floodlit kids coaching zone.

name: That Knave, Raleigh
description:
Following their five-star show, I, Elizabeth, the award-winning Dyad Productions (A Christmas Carol, Lady Susan, A Room of One’s Own, Christmas Gothic, Austen’s Women, Female Gothic) return to the Elizabethan era.  To the famous and fabulous Elizabethan explorer, sailor, dandy, and warrior, Sir Walter Raleigh. Elizabeth I’s favourite and James I’s knave. 

This is a journey through the astonishing highs and lows of one of Britain’s most famous men from history. But there’s so much you don’t know…

£16/£18 OTD

Tickets can be purchased via the Ropery Hall website, in person, or over the phone on 01652 660380.

name: The Arc Westcliff Breastfeeding Support Group
description: A drop-in breastfeeding support group run by trained peer supporters for mothers and their little ones at any stage on their breastfeeding journey. Partners and siblings are welcome too. Please come along to meet other breastfeeding mums, share experiences or simply socialise. You don't need to have any issues or concerns to access the group but if you do we will try our best to help you or signpost you to the people who will provide the right support.

organization.name: NL Family
organization.description: NL Family hubs - supporting families across North Lincolnshire

name: The Baths Hall
description:
A former public bath house, the original Baths Hall building dates from 1931. Serving as an entertainment venue since the 1970s, it underwent a major renovation, re-opening in 2005.

Closing again to undergo further development, the building in its current form was relaunched on the 11 November 2011, with comedian Bill Bailey and guests performing on the opening evening. Since 2011, the likes of Florence + The Machine, Paul Weller, the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra, The Courteeners, The Hairy Bikers, Arcade Fire, UB40, Enter Shikari and Jason Manford have all performed at the venue.

A flexible space, the main auditorium can cater for up to 1,000 people seated, or 1,800 with a mixture of seating and standing, and our bars and ancillary spaces play host to smaller live performances, as well as our workshop and community programme of dance, drama and music.

Located in the heart of Scunthorpe, the venue hosts a multi-genre programme of the very best touring comedy, music and entertainment, as well as a hugely popular annual pantomime.

Please see our website for what's on and booking tickets: www.scunthorpetheatres.co.uk


Please note our Box Office is closed on weekends during August.

organization.name: Scunthorpe Theatres
organization.description: Welcome to Scunthorpe Theatres, and our two fabulous venues - welcoming and inclusive spaces where everyone can enjoy the wonderful performances on our stages or celebrate their own creativity.

name: The Blue Moon Band
description:
The Blue Moon is a vintage Rock’n’Roll band from the Watford, UK (the home of Rock’n’Roll, we’re sure you’ll agree!) the band have been playing sweaty pubs, festivals and even a few European bar tours to learn from audience reactions in readiness for their album. In 2024 the band were able to make the trip to Chem19 studios in Glasgow to record the tracks live with Jamie Savage (Twilight Sad, King Creosote). A huge hand was given by friend, musician and composer Andy Bruce (Kathyrn Williams, Michelle Stodart) who wrote the horns, and Jim Barne on backing vocals. They aimed to create a set of tunes that represent the band’s ‘live show energy’, combining driving soul grooves and powerful, uplifting choruses. This completed they are now back on the road to promote this new material.

£14/£16 OTD

Tickets can be purchased from the Ropery Hall website, in person, or over the phone on 01652 660380

name: The Bridge: Eduardo Martin and Ahmed Dickinson
description:
The Bridge is Cuba’s most internationally acclaimed guitar duo. With their musical empathy, Eduardo Martín and Ahmed Dickinson transform their concerts into a vehicle that connects, incorporates and juxtaposes their different generations; and the spiritual journey that drives their thrilling yet soothing performances.

Like many other Cubans or Caribbean, they enjoy a natural sense of rhythm. The guitar is their favoured instrument, which idiomatically conveys all the melodic and rhythmic intricacies of South- America’s cultural diversity. 

The Bridge is a compilation of the most alluring works for two guitars by Grammy nominee composer Eduardo Martín. Here, classical styles and rock merge with son montunos; old Yoruba chants, feel-good rumbas, funk-boleros, new age tunes and cinematic pieces sit alongside Cuban tumbaos with slap bass. 

£15/£17 OTD

Tickets can be purchased via the Ropery Hall website, in person, or over the phone on 01652 660380

name: The Carents Room
description:
Are you supporting an elderly parent, friend or relative 

The Carents Room is a free website for anyone helping to support an older adult.  It gives you the information and connections to help you both stay safe and well. 

Link: www.carents.co.uk

Carents Lounge 

The Carents Lounge is a private Facebook group providing peer to peer support for adults who are caring for older relatives, partners or friends. 

Link: https://www.facebook.com/groups/carentslounge

The Carents Room on Social Media 

Follow The Carents Room on social media for regular tips to keep you and those you love safe and well

organization.name: The Carents Room
organization.description:
CARENTS?
Our word for mid life children providing care for elderly relatives in the community.

CARENTING?
Our word for the multitude of activities carents undertake as first aiders, homemakers, care coordinators, personal shoppers, chauffeurs, secretaries and financial or legal advisers.

THE CARENTS ROOM
Our mission is to make carenting and ageing a happier, healthier and more engaged experience.

Founded by Dr Jackie Gray, a dually qualified GP and Consultant in Public Health Medicine, with over 30 years of experience tackling the consequences of ageing in individuals and communities. Using insights from the direct experience of caring for her elderly father and being supported by others in similar roles.

Jackie’s experience showed that ageing and caring in the UK can be isolating and challenging, compounded by a shortage of suitable information, services, products and experiences which could make life easier for busy carents and their ageing parents.

The Carents Room has been informed by the available research and expert public health guidance on supporting elderly parents. It has tips with what to expect, what to ask and where to go for expert advice and help. The information is available 24/7 and developed to NHS information standards.

name: The Carter Sampson Band
description: Carter Sampson, from Oklahoma, is an award winning musician and songwriter.  Her high quality song writing and gorgeous vocals make her one of the very best around.  She will perform with her UK band comprising of Joe Coombs (guitar), Scott Warman (bass) and Jamie Dawson (drums).

organization.name: Town Hall Live Kirton in Lindsey
organization.description: Bringing you the best of UK and Trans-Atlantic folk and roots music. Browse or search our events below to find out more about what’s happening at Town Hall Live. For more information on the artists please click their name. To reserve tickets call Brian Chudley: 01652 649230 or you can purchase tickets through this link https://www.wegottickets.com/kirtontownhall

name: The Churchfitters Christmas Cracker
description:
The Churchfitters is a folk group like no other. A double bass made out of scrap metal. Heart-wrenching vocals accompanied by a musical saw. Foot-stomping fiddle mixed with infectious funk-rock rhythms. Their “Christmas Cracker” show is a mouthwatering selection of traditional and original festive season songs which will see Christmas in with a bang, a paper hat-full of surprises, novelties – and some terrible jokes too!

£14/£16 OTD

Book tickets via The Ropewalk

name: The Good Grief Trust
description:
The Good Grief Trust exists to help all those affected by grief in the UK. Our vision is to help those bereaved from day one, acknowledge their grief and provide reassurance, a virtual hand of friendship and ongoing support.

We bring bereavement services together, to ensure that everyone receives the tailored support they need to move forward with their lives.

  • With approx 650,000 deaths in the UK every year, at some time in our lives ALL of us will be affected by grief and none of us know how we will react to the death of someone close until it happens.
  • Run by the bereaved, for the bereaved, we aim to normalise grief and raise awareness of the impact of grief on a national platform. 
  • We aim to encourage talking about grief in a more honest, straightforward way, help to make the pain a little more bearable for those at the early stages and offer inspiration and hope to the bereaved further along their own grief ‘journey’.

Please visit the website for support and information relating to grief following the loss of family members and friends.

organization.name: Good Grief Trust
organization.description:
We’re so sorry you had to find us, but we want you to know that you're not alone and we will try our best to guide you in the right direction.  We offer our heartfelt condolences to anyone who has suffered a bereavement under any circumstance.

We know that many of those who are bereaved, across the UK, do not know where to turn for help. The Good Grief Trust has a choice of 1000 + charities and tailored local and national support services under one umbrella.
We want to help you find the support you need as quickly as possible. You will find stories from others who have had a similar loss, practical and emotional support and signposting to a choice of immediate tailored local and national support on each of our pages below.

Our hope is that you find useful information, helplines, advice and encouraging stories from others to help you in this most difficult of times and to find a way forward with your life.

name: The Guilty Men
description:
Days of the Supergroup may be long past… but The Guilty Men would surely qualify for that description! The band is made up of five of the finest musicians from the Northwest of England. Between them, they have played over 10,000 gigs on planet Earth, recorded thousands of songs and made countless radio and TV appearances. To say they’re experienced would be an understatement!

The story starts in 1979, in Manchester, England. Clive Gregson and Neil Cossar met through a mutual friend, John Martin, the bassist in The Cheaters… Neil was the band’s guitarist. Clive was the leader of Any Trouble. The Cheaters had a PA, Any Trouble owned a van. It made sense to pool resources, often with both bands on the same bill… happy days!

Any Trouble signed to Stiff Records, The Cheaters signed to EMI. Both bands released several albums and played thousands of shows. Both bands ran their course… Clive then went on to a successful partnership with singer Christine Collister, released over 20 solo albums, and spent 15 years in Nashville working as a session musician and producer. Neil became a radio DJ, formed a Music PR company and launched the online brand This Day in Music, before becoming a music book publisher.

Cut to 2021… lifelong friends Clive and Neil are catching up over lunch and thought it might be fun to try and write some songs together… Several weeks and quite a few songs later, they decided to expand the enterprise from a songwriting workshop to a full blown band. Clive recruited keyboardist Jez Smith and bassist Craig Fletcher from John Lees’ Barclay James Harvest… and the lineup was completed with the addition of legendary drummer, Paul Burgess, who has played with 10cc since 1973. They named the band The Guilty Men… and headed into the recording studio.

Cut to 2024… and The Guilty Men’s debut album “Invisible Confetti” is ready to roll. 13 brand new songs recorded in the old-fashioned way: everybody playing live in the studio, intent on catching the moment. Most of the songs were laid down in no more than two or three takes… and with four featured lead vocalists, the album covers a lot of musical bases. “Invisible Confetti” rocks… with nods to Americana, country, folk, pop, psychedelia… it’s an exhilarating ride from start to finish. All aboard!

Tickets £15/£17 OTD

Book via Ropery Hall website

name: The Hidden Valley
description: Hidden Valley is the story of the discovery and excavation of two Anglo-Saxon cemeteries at the site of Sawcliffe in Roxby cum Risby during the 1990s. The exhibition will be looking at how these cemeteries fit into the landscape around them and how they relate to other sites in the local area. Together, these sites reveal the fascinating history of Winterton Vale, the Hidden Valley, and its place in Anglo-Saxon England.

organization.name: North Lincolnshire Museum
organization.description:
Discover the history of North Lincolnshire at our free museum near the centre of Scunthorpe.

A visit to the Museum is a step back in time through fascinating hands-on displays. Learn about some of North Lincolnshire’s amazing objects and stories. Explore the geology, local history and archaeology galleries. Discover how that history has been shaped by the landscape. Families can visit Dudley’s Den, a dedicated Under 5s space.

With a changing programme of family friendly exhibitions and events for all ages. Families can join Dudley Bear and explore by taking part in fun filled activities and crafts. Learn about North Lincolnshire with trails, back packs and family explorer packs.

Admission is free.

name: The Hospital Players
description:
The Hospital Players, established in 1943, are the longest-running amateur dramatics group in Scunthorpe, North Lincolnshire. Over the years, they have staged over 230 productions. They perform two shows a year at the Plowright Theatre, showcasing a variety of plays and productions.

When rehearsing for a production, the group aims to meet 2-3 times a week between 7.30pm - 9.30pm however the days are interchangeable and depends on the availability of the cast and crew. Please contact the group directly for more information on rehearsal and performance times.

Known for their friendly and welcoming atmosphere, the group encourages members to participate both on and off stage. From acting and directing to set design and costume making, there are numerous opportunities for members to contribute and develop new skills.

Being part of an amateur dramatics society like The Hospital Players offers numerous benefits, particularly for mental health. Engaging in creative activities such as acting and stage production can significantly reduce stress and anxiety by providing a constructive outlet for emotions. The sense of community and teamwork fosters strong social connections, which are crucial for emotional well-being. Additionally, the process of learning lines, rehearsing, and performing can boost self-confidence and provide a sense of accomplishment. Overall, participating in amateur dramatics can enhance mental health and well-being through creativity, social interaction, and personal growth.

There is much more to do in an amateur dramatics society than just acting. Members can get involved in set design, creating the visual backdrop for the performances, which can be a highly rewarding and creative endeavour. Working on props involves crafting and sourcing items that bring authenticity to the play, stimulating creativity and problem-solving skills. Lighting and sound are crucial for setting the mood and enhancing the audience’s experience, requiring technical skills and precision. Working backstage, managing the flow of the performance, and ensuring everything runs smoothly can be incredibly fulfilling. Each of these roles provides a sense of purpose and achievement, contributing to mental well-being by fostering a sense of belonging, enhancing self-esteem, and offering a productive way to channel energy and creativity.

Backstage Roles:

  • Set Design:
    • Creating visual backdrops for performances.
    • Collaborating with directors to achieve the desired aesthetic.
    • Building and painting sets.
    • Ensuring sets are safe and functional.
  • Set Construction:
    • Building the physical structures for the set.
    • Using carpentry and construction skills.
    • Ensuring the set is sturdy and safe.
    • Collaborating with set designers and directors.
  • Props:
    • Crafting and sourcing items for authenticity.
    • Managing and organising props during rehearsals and performances.
    • Repairing and maintaining props.
    • Collaborating with actors and directors to ensure prop accuracy.
  • Lighting and Sound:
    • Setting up and operating lighting and sound equipment.
    • Designing lighting and sound effects to enhance the performance.
    • Troubleshooting technical issues.
    • Coordinating with the director and stage manager for cues.
  • Backstage Management:
    • Managing the flow of the performance.
    • Ensuring smooth transitions between scenes.
    • Coordinating with actors and crew.
    • Handling emergencies and unexpected issues.
  • Prompt:
    • Assisting actors with lines during rehearsals.
    • Ensuring actors stay on script during performances.
    • Providing cues for entrances and exits.
    • Helping maintain the pace of the performance.
  • Directing:
    • Interpreting the script and developing a vision for the production.
    • Guiding actors in their performances.
    • Collaborating with designers and technical crew.
    • Overseeing rehearsals and making creative decisions.
  • Stage Hands:
    • Moving sets and props during performances.
    • Assisting with scene changes.
    • Ensuring the stage is safe and organised.
    • Supporting the technical crew as needed.
  • Front of House:
    • Greeting and assisting audience members.
    • Managing ticket sales and seating arrangements.
    • Providing information about the performance.
    • Ensuring a positive audience experience.

Being part of a society of like-minded individuals also has significant benefits. It creates a supportive environment where members can share their passion for theatre and learn from each other. This camaraderie helps build lasting friendships and a sense of community, which can be incredibly comforting and motivating. The shared experiences and collective efforts towards a common goal can enhance feelings of connectedness and reduce feelings of isolation, further promoting mental health and overall well-being.

The Hospital Players also give back to the community by making regular donations to the Scunthorpe Hospital League of Friends charity, supporting local healthcare services and fostering a sense of community involvement.

In summary, The Hospital Players offer a rich and varied experience that goes beyond acting, providing numerous opportunities for personal growth and mental well-being. Whether you’re on stage or behind the scenes, being part of this community can be a deeply rewarding and enriching experience. The combination of creative expression, technical skills, and social interaction makes amateur dramatics a powerful tool for enhancing mental health and fostering a sense of belonging and accomplishment.

​​​​​​​
pc_attendingAccess_additionalInfo: We welcome all members of the community to come along and see what we are about.

organization.name: The Hospital Players
organization.description:
The Hospital Players are the longest running amateur dramatic group in Scunthorpe, North Lincolnshire, originally opening the tabs in 1943.
 
The Hospital Players currently put on 3 shows a year at Scunthorpe's Plowright Theatre. We are a very friendly amateur dramatics group. As a group we pride ourselves on giving the best performances possible, but we think it's very important to have fun along the way! 2023 marks the 80th anniversary of our first production, The Admirable Crichton. You can learn all about our interesting history here.

 The Hospital Players rehearse at the Grange Farm Community Centre in Scunthorpe. Putting on a play involves so much more than rehearsing a script. As a group we design and build our own sets; design, record and edit our own sound and lighting plot. We write, film and edit our own trailers, design the posters, source and sometimes make the costumes, and so much more! There are plenty of things to get involved with on and off the stage, and we always welcome new members to the group.

So if you are 16+ and looking to join a fun, exciting and friendly group then look no further. You can be as involved as you want to be! If you are interested in becoming a Hospital Player please visit the Contact part of the website.

name: The MoveMENt
description:
The MoveMENt

Welcome to our dedicated initiative and Community Interest Company, in North Lincolnshire, focused on enhancing the holistic well-being of men. Our mission is clear: we aim to provide a comprehensive service that addresses physical health, mental health, and overall well-being. Through individual and group sessions, we focus on key aspects such as health, fitness, lifestyle choices, nutrition, mindset, and the critical issue of suicide prevention.

​Our Commitment: 

It is our unwavering commitment to be at the forefront of advancing health and saving men's lives for the public benefit. Our primary focus is on the advancement of mental health and preventing the tragic loss of lives to suicide. By addressing the unique challenges faced by men, we strive to make a positive impact on their lives and the lives of their families.​

Holistic Approach: 

We believe in a holistic approach to health that encompasses physical, mental, and emotional well-being. Our individual and group sessions are tailored to meet the specific needs of men in the community. Whether it's promoting healthy lifestyle choices, improving fitness, or addressing mental health concerns, our goal is to empower men to lead fulfilling and balanced lives.

In Memory of Andy MacDonald: 

Our journey is inspired by the memory of our dear friend, Andy MacDonald, who tragically lost his life to suicide in February 2022. In his honour, we aim to create a safe haven where men can unite, supporting one another in enhancing their overall well-being. We offer on-site counselling services and collaborate with other networks such as Andy’s Man Club to actively prevent suicide in our community.

Suicide Prevention Advocacy: 

A core aspect of our mission is to actively contribute to suicide prevention efforts. We understand the urgency and importance of addressing this critical issue. Our actions include providing relevant information, offering advice, raising awareness, conducting educational programmes, and offering support to individuals and families impacted by mental health challenges and suicide.

Community Impact: 

We are dedicated to benefiting not only men but also their families and those directly affected by mental health challenges and suicide. Through our initiatives, we aim to contribute to the broader societal shift towards open discussions on suicide prevention and work towards making deaths by suicide rare events in the UK.

Information, Advice, and Support: 

We provide a range of services, including information dissemination, advice on mental health matters, and crucial support mechanisms. Our team is committed to creating an environment where men feel comfortable seeking help, and we actively work towards reducing the stigma associated with mental health challenges.

Join us on our mission to enhance the well-being of men in North Lincolnshire. Together, let's create a community where mental health is openly discussed, and lives are saved through proactive measures and support systems.

What services are offered within The MoveMENt:

  • Private Personal Training Sessions
  • Semi-Private Personal Training Sessions
  • Workout Plans
  • Nutritional Advice
  • Mindset Coaching & Support
  • Progress Tracking & Health Check
  • Online Membership to exclusive material
  • Mental Health Wellbeing and Counselling Sessions
  • Monthly Walk and Talk
  • Men Support Groups (Andy's Man Club)

​

organization.name: New Beginnings
organization.description:
New Beginnings Personal Training and Wellness Facility offer the highest quality services and treatments for mind, body and wellness.


Our services are provided by highly qualified personal trainers who are experts in their field and hand selected by the New Beginning's owner and founder, Stacey Greenfield. 


Feeling good is a complex issue. Health is at the heart of it, but psychology has a role to play as well, and we need to have that feeling of looking good.


New Beginnings brings together a range of services for mind, body and wellness to help our clients be fit and well inside and out. The best way to great health is to look after the whole body, not just the physical aspects but also the mental issues as well; as the saying goes "Healthy Body, Healthy Mind".


Looking after your health as a whole package is so important, yet it is something that far too many people sadly neglect.  Our range of services has been put together in such a way that many of them complement each other.


Our fully equipped personal training studio allows clients to work out in comfort and privacy. In addition this allows clients to also benefit from the expert advice of our personal trainers either with one-to-one support based on their individual goals or small group classes such as yoga.


Our New Beginnings founder is also qualified in nutrition and is available to put together the best possible programme to assist with weight loss, fitness issues and helping to create a health body. For those clients who have issues with food, we can assist with this. Helping you to create a more positive and healthier person both on the outside and as well as on the inside can give you the real boost of confidence that can be invaluable in both a professional and personal capacity. 

From counselling to life coaching, our highly professional team can help you to overcome whatever it is that is preventing you from achieving your goals.

name: The Pantry
description: The pantry is an affordable grocery shop where you can pick up items often for a thirds of the price as well as access free food when available.

organization.name: Oasis Community Space (formerly The Crosby Collective)
organization.description:
We are bringing together people from Scunthorpe and North Lincolnshire – both current residents and the diaspora – who love our area and care about its future.

Our objectives are to:
• Build connections and start a conversation about the opportunities and challenges facing our area
• Drive action through connecting local projects with people who can help
• Role model a different culture and mindset about what is possible when people work together.

name: The Peacock Retreat Holistic Wellbeing & Coaching
description:
You can't pour from an empty cup! I help people in a caring role to improve their overall sense of wellbeing through a combination of holistic treatments and coaching strategies so they are able to thrive in their caring role, whether that be personally or professionally -  teachers, family carers, parents, emergency workers or anyone with a health challenge. 

I can help you to sleep better, feel better and look better naturally and find simple ways to incorporate tiny acts of selfcare into your busy everyday. Book a one off treatment or coaching programme or truly invest in you with a free holistic wellbeing assessment so I can put together a comprehensive selfcare plan to get you back to feeling like your best self again and able to best support those you love and care for.

Services on offer include:

* Certified Sleep Better coaching (group and one to one)

* Wellbeing Boost one to one bespoke coaching

* Reiki relaxation to help your mind, body and spirit to heal by reducing the negative effects of stress

* Indian Head Massage - to ease neck and shoulder tension, reduce the frequency of headaches and migraines and improve the sense of overall wellbeing 

* Mindfulness courses: group and  1:2:1   

* Holistic facials & natural skincare advice

*Wellbeing Club which includes access to an online membership of wellbeing and mindfulness resources plus monthly in-person events and on-going support via a private WhatsApp community from only £15 per month. Also, the option to add a regular monthly in-person treatment to your membership at a discounted rate to help you commit to your wellbeing for the long-term.
pc_attendingAccess_additionalInfo: Mainly treatments are in person at the venue but some are available by phone or video so contact for more info

organization.name: The Peacock Retreat Holistic Wellbeing
organization.description: Holistic wellbeing practitioner based in Hibaldstow, North Lincolnshire offering holistic treatments to help you sleep better, feel better and look better naturally. Reiki, Indian Head Massage, Holistic Facials and Crystal Healing

name: The Regen Shop
description:
The Regen Shop is the fund-raising centre of the Regen Group and sits at the heart of Crowle - both physically (we're on the High Street) and emotionally (loved by locals and visitors for bargains and an outlet for the goods you'd like to repurpose).

Come along for a browse in the Shop or bring us your unwanted, quality goods to contribute to our vibrant community project.

organization.name: The Crowle and Ealand Regeneration project Ltd
organization.description: The Crowle and Ealand Regeneration project Ltd is a not for profit organisation lead by volunteers

name: The Ropewalk
description:
Gallery and Exhibition Space, Live Venue, Artists Studios and Museum.

Barton upon Humber's cultural quarter of a mile!

For more information please visit the website.

name: The Rosie Hood Band
description:
A Horizon Folk Award nominee, Rosie Hood is known for her powerful, clear vocals and captivating performances combining poetic writing with honest interpretations of traditional English songs. In her ‘Classy’ (MOJO) 4-piece, Rosie is joined by fiddle-player Nicola Beazley, melodeon-player & percussionist Robyn Wallace and fiddle-player Rosie Butler-Hall. The instrumentalists bring dynamic lift and drive, expanding Rosie’s vision to re-work traditional songs and bring unheard stories to life. ‘To me, the story is always the most important thing, that’s the ‘Seed Of Gold’ within a song’ explains Rosie. The band released their debut album, Seed of Gold, in November 2023.

£15/£17 OTD

Tickets can be booked via the Ropery Hall website, in person, or over the phone on 01652 660380

name: The Shed on The Isle
description:
We are The Shed on the Isle in Epworth (on the Isle of Axholme) at the rear of The Thurlow Pavilion Station Road Epworth.

We have a creative space for people to come along, tinker and meet people.  Many activities are available whilst you're there, woodworking, crafts and many other things.

The Shed on the Isle is part of the Men in shed's project, But we are open to all, not just men.  

You can also find more information about Sheds at.

https://menssheds.org.uk/ and https://www.meninshedshumber.co.uk/
pc_attendingAccess_additionalInfo: Join us and see if its for You

organization.name: The Shed on The Isle
organization.description:
Men’s Sheds are part of an international movement which started in Australia during the 1990’s aimed at improving the health and wellbeing of men. You can now find hundreds of Sheds across the UK, Canada, Denmark, Sweden, New Zealand, USA and Ireland as well as Australia.

The main purpose of Men’s Sheds is to help us remain connected after we retire, if we become unemployed, if we are bereaved, or when we are facing difficult times in our lives. We may simply be looking for something to do and a place to go where we can have a laugh, enjoy a bit of banter, drink copious amounts of tea and eat too many biscuits.
One of our members, age (well over) 80 years, said “Coming to the Shed is better than any Doctors prescription.”

Men’s Sheds are probably much more than you expected, especially if you thought, as many do, that we work out of garden sheds. Our Sheds come in all shapes and sizes and are for people over the age of 18. 

The Shed on The Isle is a new Shed joining several others across the area.  It is based on the site of Thurlow Pavillion, Station Road, Epworth.

It is not fully open yet, there is an open day planned for 23rd February 10am - 4pm. Come along and see all the wonderful things that will be on offer when it is a fully functional Shed!

https://www.meninshedshumber.co.uk/images/shop/more/636x900_37_4d4d5f60abdb78756ec73e728a050bc4_1673360011Shedopenday.jpeg

name: The Ted Lewis Centre
description:
The Ted Lewis Centre is a heritage centre, standing exhibition and archive dedicated to the art, life and times of Bartonian Edward Alfred (Ted) Lewis, author of "Get Carter" and eight other novels. Ted was also a graphic artist and jazz musician.

 The centre is open by appointment for single or group visits – please see website for details and to arrange booking. 

Between April to November we are also open on Sundays for walk ins 10am to 4pm. Please visit the website for more information.

organization.name: The Ted Lewis Centre
organization.description:
Inspired by the Ted Lewis Group (2013 -2020), The Ted Lewis Centre is a Charitable Incorporated Organisation governed by local trustees.
Membership is open to all those who are interested in the art, life and times of Edward (Ted) Lewis (1940 – 1982). The membership year commences on 15th June and the fee is £10 per annum which entitles each member to 20% off each book or artefact purchased
8A8965-(Ted_Lewis_Centre)
Enthusiastic volunteers are also welcomed to undertake reception at the Centre.
Our objective is to present an ever-changing standing exhibition and to store a Ted Lewis archive for study and understanding. The Centre arranges publication and sale of Ted Lewis novels on licence from the Estate of Ted Lewis and biographies and Barton Ted Lewis Trail.

name: The Thursday Book Club
description:
If you would like to join a friendly and welcoming reading group, The Thursday Book Club is looking for new members to help investigate its book choices!


The group meets in the first floor Creatorspace at Scunthorpe Central at 10.30am on the first Thursday of the month.


Contact library.enquiries@northlincs.gov.uk to find out more and get in touch with the group.


Please note these details were correct at time of publication.

name: Three Voices with Ruth Lee
description: We are delighted to welcome back harpist Ruth Lee for our May 19th gig. She is an award-winning composer and performer who wowed us all last time she played for us. We are lucky to have such an outstanding musician, recognised nationally and internationally, to perform as part of our event. Find out more: https://www.ruthleeharpist.com/

name: Tiny Tigers
description: A specifically designed martial arts class for 4-7 year olds

organization.name: Twin Tigers Martial Arts
organization.description:
PROVIDING QUALITY MARTIAL ARTS FOR OVER 15 YEARS
Since we opened in June 2006, we’ve seen seasons come and ago. Timid students transform into warriors, students becoming trainers and a whole lot of changes at our venue. But no matter who’s training or what we’ve had to train with, our goal has remained the same – to provide our community of Scunthorpe and North Lincolnshire with the finest Martial Arts education we can offer.

We are blessed to have an incredible team of dedicated instructors including Master grades in both our key martial arts.

At the core of the team Master Smith and wife Lisa Smith work to maintain the family values of the school. Although several of the instructors share the Smith surname it is only coincidence.

Most of our instructors joined Twin Tigers to follow their own path many years ago and have since decided to share the life skills and benefits they found with others.

Twin Tigers is dedicated to developing our students, through a martial arts education.

Our instruction team work tirelessly to get the best out of each student. We ensure that our student’s progression is earned, never given. No matter the skill level or ability, we tailor our student’s experiences to secure the best Martial Arts education possible, for children, adults and everyone in between, we have a class for you.

We believe not only do we have the best instruction team in the area, we also have the best facilities by far

name: Togetherness Singing Group
description:
A dementia friendly singing group run by volunteers. 

We sing on Tuesdays from 6pm until 7pm and have refreshments afterwards. 

No singing skills are necessary it is about enjoying the event. The research is extensive about the benefits of singing for people living with dementia. The group has been running for 10 years.   

Please note the session runs every other Tuesday - please ring the Memory Service to confirm the next date.

organization.name: RDash Memory Service
organization.description: Singing group for people living with Dementia taking place in Scunthorpe

name: Tourettes Syndrome and ADHD Support
description:
As a charity we support individuals affected by Tourettes Syndrome and ADHD. We offer school support which includes training, assemblies and meetings. We also run various social groups and face to face appointments to discuss the areas of support you may need.

We also offer adult support for those seeking information or help.

Our sessions are based in Hull, please get in touch if you wish to attend.

For more information visit the website.

organization.name: T.I.C. Yorkshire
organization.description:
Providing support to anyone affected by Tourettes Syndrome and Tic disorders within Hull, Lincolnshire and Yorkshire.

Join us at support meetings or outings or even a relaxed cuppa and a chat in a safe environment free of judgement!

Charity Registered Number - 1184015
Our Aim at T.I.C. - To help create a future of acceptance and understanding for those living with Tourettes Syndrome.

Tourette Syndrome is a neurological condition affecting 1 in 100 children. It is a lifelong condition that can sometimes see a reduction in symptoms during late teens and adulthood.

Co-founders of T.I.C. and fellow mums to children with Tourettes Syndrome, Kim Mitchell and Beverley Wright, decided that a proactive approach was needed within the community. After attending courses delivered by Tourettes Action (UK) and Susan Connors MEd President of the Greater New York State chapter of the Tourette Association, Kim and Beverley began to deliver awareness talks to local schools and colleges across Hull, Lincolnshire and Yorkshire.

T.I.C. became a non-registered charity in October 2018 receiving it's registration in June 2019, with the aim to promote awareness within the area and give those affected by Tourettes Syndrome and Tic Disorders the support they need when they need it.

name: Town Hall Craft Club
description:
A friendly, informal meeting of like-minded crafters.

Bring your latest project along and perhaps learn a new technique from the other users.

There is lots of space and big tables for anyone wanting to bring a sewing machine etc.

There are spinners, sewers, felters and knitters and we happily welcome those who like to paint and sketch too. So if you're looking to learn a new skill there’s bound to be someone to help you get started.

Please see https://www.kirtoninlindsey.com/townhallcraftclub for full details

name: Town Hall Live
description:
Live music.  Town Hall Live are committed to bringing the best in roots, Americana and folk music from America, Canada, Australia and the UK to Kirton - in - Lindsey.

Concerts are held at the Diamond Jubilee Town Hall, Market Square, DN21 4LZ, and are usually held on Friday/ Saturday evenings.  Door time is 7pm.  The music starts at 7.45pm. Please visit the website for details of specific events and dates. 

The Town Hall is a charitable organisation.  Town Hall works within the umbrella of the Town Hall, and without any outside funding.  Ticket prices range from £14 to £18.

organization.name: Town Hall Live Kirton in Lindsey
organization.description: Bringing you the best of UK and Trans-Atlantic folk and roots music. Browse or search our events below to find out more about what’s happening at Town Hall Live. For more information on the artists please click their name. To reserve tickets call Brian Chudley: 01652 649230 or you can purchase tickets through this link https://www.wegottickets.com/kirtontownhall

name: Tree planting in North Lincolnshire
description:
TCV (The Conservation Volunteers) Hull and Humber plants thousands of trees around North Lincolnshire, Hull and East Riding each year apart of Humber Forest. Humber forest is 1 of 15 Community Forests in England.

From November to March we get out with volunteers, community groups and businesses to plant new woodland and hedgerows. Through spring and summer we also go back and complete tree maintenance to boost the survival rate of the trees planted.

Join in, get active and make a difference in your local community!

Please contact us for future dates and locations we have planned.

organization.name: The Conservation Volunteers
organization.description:
We bring people together to create, improve and care for green spaces. From local parks and community gardens to Local Nature Reserves and Sites of Special Scientific Interest; from school grounds and hospital grounds to waterways, wetlands and woodlands; we connect people to the green spaces that form a vital part of any healthy, happy community.

Our team of dedicated, passionate staff and volunteers work with communities across England, Northern Ireland and Scotland and, through our Community Network, we support local community groups across the UK.

name: Trent Valley Gliding Club
description:
Trent Valley Gliding Club is a flying club run by a group of approximately 70 volunteer members, based 1 mile south of Kirton In Lindsey in North Lincolnshire.

Our large grass airfield and club house is within easy reach of Gainsborough, Scunthorpe, Lincoln, Grimsby and the surrounding towns.

We are a British Gliding Association member Club, with fully qualified and approved instructors, have a fleet of club gliders and aircraft that members, those learning and visitors fly. Many members have their own gliders, often in a syndicate with another member or two.

So, whether you are completely new to the sport or have been gliding for years and are looking for a new base – call in and see what we have to offer.

The best way to contact is to email or check out https://www.kirtoninlindsey.com/gliding for further details.

organization.name: kirtoninlindsey.com
organization.description:
kirtoninlindsey.com is a community website featuring information on all facilities, community groups, fitness classes and useful links in the area.

Kirton in Lindsey is a picturesque town in Lincolnshire and is situated approximately an hour’s drive from the cities of Leeds and Sheffield, and only 30 minutes from Lincoln.

name: U3A North Lindsey - Archery
description:
Interest groups are the backbone of the U3A. Groups are formed by like-minded members who wish to promote interest and learning in subjects new and old. Most groups are of a self-help nature where knowledge and interest is shared with the emphasis on pleasure. No qualifications needed or given - merely active participation and enthusiasm!

Group Leaders take on the responsibility for operation and organisation - not a difficult task, this merely involves setting dates and times, organising a venue and dealing with any fees/room hire costs incurred.

Group Leaders may or may not have expertise in the subject. Some groups may have more than one Leader, some members share the responsibility and in other groups, the leadership may pass from one member to another. Anyone can start a group so if you have a skill or interest you are willing to share, then you will be welcome to create a new group. The key is enjoyment and members may belong to as many groups as they wish.

Groups may have several different venues - some meet regularly at Scawby Village Hall, some at local pubs and many are at the homes of members. Unless it is stated otherwise, Interest Group meetings are held once a month.

Please note that only full paid-up members of the U3A may join the Interest Groups.

organization.name: U3A - North Lindsey
organization.description:
Welcome to North Lindsey U3A
For those retired but not tired of life! Join us on a journey of enjoyment, friendship and discovery.
If any of the following apply to you, then the U3A may be for you:
Are you retired or semi-retired?
Do you want to meet other people with similar interests to your own?
Do you want to follow up on one of your interests?
Are you looking for a new interest or hobby?
Are you lonely and in need of friendship?
We welcome anyone who is keen to join with us to promote wellbeing, learning and friendship among the retired and semi-retired community.
The U3A stands for 'The University of the Third Age' - the first age being childhood, the second age is caring or employment and the third - retirement. We never stop learning! That is the basic ethos of the U3A but with the emphasis on fun, friendship, sociability and enjoyment! The motto of the U3A is, Learn, Laugh, Live and that ethos is shared by all the members.
