THIS GROUP TAKES PLACE AT VARIOUS LOCATIONS AROUND THE AREA. NOT SCAWBY VILLAGE HALL

organization.name: U3A - North Lindsey
organization.description:
Welcome to North Lindsey U3A
For those retired but not tired of life! Join us on a journey of enjoyment, friendship and discovery.
If any of the following apply to you, then the U3A may be for you:
Are you retired or semi-retired?
Do you want to meet other people with similar interests to your own?
Do you want to follow up on one of your interests?
Are you looking for a new interest or hobby?
Are you lonely and in need of friendship?
We welcome anyone who is keen to join with us to promote wellbeing, learning and friendship among the retired and semi-retired community.
The U3A stands for 'The University of the Third Age' - the first age being childhood, the second age is caring or employment and the third - retirement. We never stop learning! That is the basic ethos of the U3A but with the emphasis on fun, friendship, sociability and enjoyment! The motto of the U3A is, Learn, Laugh, Live and that ethos is shared by all the members.

name: U3A North Lindsey - Computer Group
description:
Interest groups are the backbone of the U3A. Groups are formed by like-minded members who wish to promote interest and learning in subjects new and old. Most groups are of a self-help nature where knowledge and interest is shared with the emphasis on pleasure. No qualifications needed or given - merely active participation and enthusiasm!

Group Leaders take on the responsibility for operation and organisation - not a difficult task, this merely involves setting dates and times, organising a venue and dealing with any fees/room hire costs incurred.

Group Leaders may or may not have expertise in the subject. Some groups may have more than one Leader, some members share the responsibility and in other groups, the leadership may pass from one member to another. Anyone can start a group so if you have a skill or interest you are willing to share, then you will be welcome to create a new group. The key is enjoyment and members may belong to as many groups as they wish.

Groups may have several different venues - some meet regularly at Scawby Village Hall, some at local pubs and many are at the homes of members. Unless it is stated otherwise, Interest Group meetings are held once a month.

Please note that only full paid-up members of the U3A may join the Interest Groups.


This session takes place at an address in SCUNTHORPE, Not Scawby Village Hall.  Please contact us for more information.

name: U3A North Lindsey - Monthly General Meeting
description:
Welcome to North Lindsey U3A

For those retired but not tired of life! Join us on a journey of enjoyment, friendship and discovery.

If any of the following apply to you, then the U3A may be for you:

Are you retired or semi-retired?
Do you want to meet other people with similar interests to your own?
Do you want to follow up on one of your interests?
Are you looking for a new interest or hobby?
Are you lonely and in need of friendship?

We welcome anyone who is keen to join with us to promote wellbeing, learning and friendship among the retired and semi-retired community.

The U3A stands for 'The University of the Third Age' - the first age being childhood, the second age is caring or employment and the third - retirement. We never stop learning! That is the basic ethos of the U3A but with the emphasis on fun, friendship, sociability and enjoyment! The motto of the U3A is, Learn, Laugh, Live and that ethos is shared by all the members.

These monthly meetings generally have a speaker for part of the meeting, and then a catch up with all members with refreshments available.

Please note that only full paid-up members of the U3A may join the sessions.

The current subscription for membership is £15 and is due on the 1st of April each year. This subscription also entitles members to a copy of the 'Third Age Matters', the National U3A's magazine which is published five times a year and is posted directly to members' homes.

description:
The Scunthorpe & District U3A has several interest groups which are individual organisations offering a wide range of interests and activities. 

All interest groups have a leader who arranges the programme and secures a venue.  Meetings take place in members homes or a commercial venue.  If in a commercial venue it is usual for the members to pay a small fee by way of a contribution towards the cost.  Some may also charge for refreshments.  Each group will nominate a contact person who acts as a contact point for enquires.

Please note that only full paid-up members of the U3A may join the Interest Groups.


​​​​​​​Qigong, pronounced “chi gong,” was developed in China thousands of years ago as part of traditional Chinese medicine. It involves using exercises to optimize energy within the body, mind, and spirit, with the goal of improving and maintaining health and well-being. Qigong has both psychological and physical components and involves the regulation of the mind, breath, and body’s movement and posture.

 In most forms of qigong:

  • Breath is slow, long, and deep. Breath patterns may switch from abdominal breathing to breathing combined with speech sounds.
  • Movements are typically gentle and smooth, aimed for relaxation.
  • Mind regulation includes focusing one’s attention and visualization.

Dynamic (active) qigong techniques primarily focus on body movements, especially movements of the whole body or arms and legs. Meditative (passive) qigong techniques can be practiced in any posture that can be maintained over time and involve breath and mind exercises, with almost no body movement.

organization.name: U3A - Scunthorpe and District
organization.description:
Welcome to North Lindsey U3A
For those retired but not tired of life! Join us on a journey of enjoyment, friendship and discovery.
If any of the following apply to you, then the U3A may be for you:
Are you retired or semi-retired?
Do you want to meet other people with similar interests to your own?
Do you want to follow up on one of your interests?
Are you looking for a new interest or hobby?
Are you lonely and in need of friendship?
We welcome anyone who is keen to join with us to promote wellbeing, learning and friendship among the retired and semi-retired community.
The U3A stands for 'The University of the Third Age' - the first age being childhood, the second age is caring or employment and the third - retirement. We never stop learning! That is the basic ethos of the U3A but with the emphasis on fun, friendship, sociability and enjoyment! The motto of the U3A is, Learn, Laugh, Live and that ethos is shared by all the members.

name: Understanding Your Child
description:
​​​​​​Gain knowledge confidence and skills to support your parenting.

Understanding your child: from toddler to teenager

This course will help you read your child’s behaviour and understanding their feelings and build effective communication techniques. This course will help you reflect on your relationship and how to nurture your child’s emotional health.

A transformative journey that can strengthen your bond with your child at every age. Designed by clinical psychologists in partnership with practitioners and parents.

Although the course is a 7-week course, parents can join at any point. Booking required.

inourplace | Solihull Approach – North Lincolnshire | inourplace

organization.name: NL Family
organization.description: NL Family hubs - supporting families across North Lincolnshire

name: Unity Fitness: Teen LGBTQIA+ Sessions
description:
Unity Fitness: Teen LGBTQIA+ Sessions are inclusive, affirming workout sessions created specifically for LGBTQIA+ teens aged 11-16. These sessions offer a supportive space for young people to explore fitness, build strength, and improve their health while connecting with others who share similar experiences and values. Each session is guided by a qualified trainer and features a mix of exercises, from strength training to cardio and flexibility work, ensuring a balanced and enjoyable workout for all fitness levels.

Beyond physical fitness, Unity Fitness focuses on fostering a positive, judgement-free environment where teens can feel safe, empowered, and celebrated for who they are. Participants have the chance to develop their confidence, learn new skills, and build lasting friendships. These sessions are an invitation to embrace wellness holistically, prioritising both body and mind, and creating a community that supports every individual’s journey.


FULLY FUNDED

organization.name: New Beginnings
organization.description:
New Beginnings Personal Training and Wellness Facility offer the highest quality services and treatments for mind, body and wellness.


Our services are provided by highly qualified personal trainers who are experts in their field and hand selected by the New Beginning's owner and founder, Stacey Greenfield. 


Feeling good is a complex issue. Health is at the heart of it, but psychology has a role to play as well, and we need to have that feeling of looking good.


New Beginnings brings together a range of services for mind, body and wellness to help our clients be fit and well inside and out. The best way to great health is to look after the whole body, not just the physical aspects but also the mental issues as well; as the saying goes "Healthy Body, Healthy Mind".


Looking after your health as a whole package is so important, yet it is something that far too many people sadly neglect.  Our range of services has been put together in such a way that many of them complement each other.


Our fully equipped personal training studio allows clients to work out in comfort and privacy. In addition this allows clients to also benefit from the expert advice of our personal trainers either with one-to-one support based on their individual goals or small group classes such as yoga.


Our New Beginnings founder is also qualified in nutrition and is available to put together the best possible programme to assist with weight loss, fitness issues and helping to create a health body. For those clients who have issues with food, we can assist with this. Helping you to create a more positive and healthier person both on the outside and as well as on the inside can give you the real boost of confidence that can be invaluable in both a professional and personal capacity. 

From counselling to life coaching, our highly professional team can help you to overcome whatever it is that is preventing you from achieving your goals.

name: Utility Warehouse
description: I can help you save money on household essential bills to cut monthly expenditure. I can also offer a way of making money by becoming a partner. I am able to answer a questions, just send me an email.

organization.name: Utility Warehouse
organization.description:
Hello, we're UW
We're the UK’s only genuine multiservice provider, trusted by over a million customers and fully regulated by Ofgem, Ofcom and the Financial Conduct Authority.

Making life simple
We'll bundle all your home services into one, simple, bill. Because we believe that when you're not worrying about price comparisons, lost passwords and piles of paperwork, you can get on with the things that really matter in life.

name: Versus Arthritis Support Group
description:
A support session for those affected by arthritis. 

Our session begins with some chair-based exercise from 1.45pm-3.30pm, followed by an open cuppa and natter session from 2.30-3.30pm.

The group also meets at other venues for coffee and social meeting. Please contact for further information.

£1 donation requested.

name: Veterans Advisory and Pensions Committees
description:
We serve and support ex-servicemen and women, their widows or widowers and their immediate family members. We are an independent voice, here to help you whenever or wherever you served, whether in World War 2 or Afghanistan.

VAPC is an advisory non-departmental public body, sponsored by the Ministry of Defence.

For more information on the VAPC for Yorkshire and Humber, please visit: VAPC: Yorkshire and Humber - GOV.UK (www.gov.uk)

name: Victor House
description:
Victor House provides a psychologically informed specialist environment that looks to support rehabilitative and recovery approaches and focus on the overall well-being of a person, including their physical and mental health and wellbeing, their level of social support (from a partner, family, or friends) and their level of community integration.   ​

Promoting recovery and rehabilitation will include enabling access to housing, education, training, and employment alongside supporting people to find and participate in rewarding leisure and community activities.  ​

Victor House creates the foundation for person to be able to begin on their recovery from a position of somewhere safe to stay.   ​

No referral is required to access the facility and we welcome everyone seven days a week between 8am to 10pm.

Alternatively, you can ring the staff based at Victor House on 07385 034880.

Victor House, 22-24 Cole Street, Scunthorpe, DN15 6QS

organization.name: Victor House
organization.description:
Victor House Is a Safe Hub offering vital support to people who are homeless or at risk of homelessness. Victor House opens seven days a week, including Christmas Day 2-6pm and Boxing Day 8-10pm providing hot drinks  and donations of food are provided when available, essential support services are offered based upon, strength based conversations and care & support needs identified. 
Showering/laundry facilities are also available.

Night Provision is available and this is based on visitors completing a form daily - with support - from the team at Victor House in order for application to be considered based on priority need.

name: Virtual Antenatal Group
description:
Virtual Antenatal Group - four week sessions. Helping to understand baby brain development, feeding, parenting, labour and birth- facilitated by infant feeding team, midwifery, health visiting services.

For further details contact family.hubs@northlincs.gov.uk

organization.name: NL Family
organization.description: NL Family hubs - supporting families across North Lincolnshire

name: Voluntary Car Service
description:
Delivery of a Voluntary Car Service across North Lincolnshire which helps people with genuine transport difficulties over the age of 18 get to important appointments such as doctors, hospitals, dentists, clinics, support groups, local shops etc.  Our volunteer drivers are available Monday to Friday between office hours.  We do not operate early mornings, evenings or weekends. 

Our volunteers give their time freely but charge a mileage rate of 45p per mile to cover the cost of fuel and other vehicle costs.  Drivers will wait up to an hour and half at a destination, but this can be flexible if more time is required.  Our drivers are DBS checked. 

Passengers are required to register with us first - we post out an information pack together with a simple registration form which we must receive back before a booking can take place. 

To find out more about the service please contact the office on 01652 637700 between the hours of 9am and 12pm - there is an answer machine facility if lines are busy.  You can also email voluntarycarservice@hwrcc.org.uk

organization.name: Humber & Wolds Rural Action
organization.description:
Humber & Wolds Rural Action's vision is that rural communities will increasingly take a leading role in ensuring the social, environmental and economic well-being of all their residents. They will do this in a way that provides for the future challenges. As one of 38 Rural Community Councils across the country, we will be there to stimulate their thinking, support their work and help turn their aspirations into reality.

There are around 11,000 rural communities across Britain ranging from small hamlets to bustling market towns, all with their own individual character and economy. However, rural communities now find themselves at a cross-roads and action is essential in order to generate more sustainable communities and lifestyles, offering a better quality of life for all who live in the countryside, not just the affluent who can afford to live there.

With global pressures such as climate change, an ageing population and long lasting constraints on public spending, it is time to generate a new vision for our rural communities that delivers better services in different ways. Only then can we provide for the needs of both current and future generations that live, work and play in the countryside.

name: Walks, Talks and Events
description:
Hello and Welcome!

The Scunthorpe Museum Society (SMS) was founded in 1957 to encourage and support an active interest in the North Lincolnshire Museum and Art Gallery. The Society also aimed to enable learning in a wide range of interests for local people.

There are currently three sections of the society: Scunthorpe Museum Art Group, Local History and Archaeology Section and The Natural History (including Ornithology) and Geology Section. Over the years the Society has part funded many activities for the North Lincolnshire Museum.

Who Runs the SMS?

The Society is run by volunteers with a Committee of Volunteers that develop the Events Programme and manage the governance and financial aspects of the group.

What Do We Do?

The Society offers a comprehensive programme of walks, talks and lectures that are open to all.

Who Can Join the SMS?

The Society welcomes everybody who is interested in the walks, talks and services that are offered. We consult with our members to ensure our Annual Programme reflects the interests of everybody so do come along to meet us. 

Do I have to be a Member to come to events?

No you don’t. You are very welcome to come to an event as a non member. 

Where are Events Held?

For inside events we meet at:

The Old Brumby United Church

Room 1 of the small Hall,

Ashby Road, Scunthorpe,

DN16 2AQ

Accessibility

The venue has ample parking and is fully accessible including toilets suitable for people with disabilities or wheelchair users.

If you have concerns or queries regarding access or support needs for an event please contact us in advance and we will do our best to make adjustments that will support you.

Meetings that are held outside - full details of venues/parking and accessibility are released with the event. 

Fees: An Annual membership that gives you access to all events is £15 

Attendance at individual events without membership is £3 per event

Where to find more Information about the Society and Our Events.

Our website - https://keithandjune12.wixsite.com/

Our Facebook Page - https://www.facebook.com/scun.museum.society

For information on how to join, plus dates and times of meetings, please contact us.

organization.name: Scunthorpe Museum Society
organization.description:
Scunthorpe Museum Society was created in 1957. There were multiple sections of the society initially but these have since reduced to three groups; Arts, Local History and Archaeology, and Natural History and Geology. Each group works independently and runs its own society but the Local History and Archaeology, and Natural History and Geology share the same venue to meet between September - April at Old Brumby United Church Hall on Monday evenings. 

Only one meeting is held in December where all sections come together for a social event. 

Please note there is a membership fee of £15 per year except the Art section who pay per meeting. 

Meetings are all advertised on the website.

name: Waste not Want not - Ashby
description:
A Pick and Mix Community shop, 15 points for £5 -6pm Tuesdays at Ashby Community Centre.  

No referrals needed, no questions asked, just turn up and support the community shop.

All profits go back into the project.

organization.name: Waste Not Want Not - Ashby
organization.description:
A Pick and Mix Community shop, 15 points for £5 -6pm Tuesdays at Ashby Community Centre.

All profits go into the project.

name: Ways to Wellness
description:
The Ways to Wellness project is supporting people with a wide range of needs. These include mental health issues, substance misuse, physical disabilities and the elderly living in the Brumby Ward (Westcliff, Riddings and surrounding neighbourhoods), who may feel lonely, isolated or lack confidence, to go to activities by themselves. We have volunteers who are trained as ‘Buddies’/Mentors who can support people.

Buddies can support people:
¨ To attend activities with you
¨ To make new friends
¨ To help build your confidence
¨ To feel less isolated
¨ To help you achieve your goals
¨ To support you to join new groups/activities

In response to covid-19 and the isolation people may be feeling as a result we have decided to offer a telephone befriending service.
 
This is for anyone who is feeling lonely or isolated and would like a regular telephone call from one of our friendly volunteers.
 If you are struggling with your Mental Health and need support finding the right services or help with benefits advice, then we may be able to help!

We have an experienced Mental Health Support Worker on hand to discuss your needs and will fully support you to find the right path forward!
Support available:
¨ Support and advice
¨ Support with form filling
¨ Short, medium and long term care planning
¨ Crisis management 
¨ Support with GP consultations 
¨ Support to reduce the impact of the Covid pandemic on mental health
¨ Support, inspiration and encouragement to reduce isolation

Please get in touch to find out more information.

organization.name: Westcliff Community Works
organization.description:
Westcliff Drop-In Centre was established in 1987 and became a registered charity in 1997.  The main focus of the Centre was to work as an independent, community project responding to the needs of the residents of the Westcliff housing estate and surrounding areas.  In 2011 the Drop-In incorporated as a company limited by guarantee. The Board comprises of 8 local residents and 2 associate members.

In May 2018 we moved from our centre, which was earmarked for demolition, into a new community building and changed our name to Westcliff Community Works.

Westcliff Community Works (WCW) is a community anchor organisation “our vision” is for a thriving, united, joyful community filled with inspiration; where all residents have the opportunities and confidence to prosper and lead happy and healthy lives.

name: We Are With You
description:
We Are With You provides drug and alcohol support for anyone over 18 in the North Lincolnshire area. We offer one to one and group support, harm reduction interventions, psychosocial support, pharmacological interventions, signposting and referrals to other services. 

If you feel you need any advice and support please give us a call or pop into the service.

organization.name: We Are With You
organization.description: Get free, confidential support with alcohol, drugs or mental health from one of our local services or online

name: Wednesday Welcome
description:
Wednesday welcome - community session for all the local community and the church.  

Held every Wednesday excluding holidays ie Christmas. 

Please contact to confirm dates.

name: Weekend Warriors
description:
A fun, fast paced martial art and fitness based class for 4-10 years.

Non Uniform or grading

organization.name: Twin Tigers Martial Arts
organization.description:
PROVIDING QUALITY MARTIAL ARTS FOR OVER 15 YEARS
Since we opened in June 2006, we’ve seen seasons come and ago. Timid students transform into warriors, students becoming trainers and a whole lot of changes at our venue. But no matter who’s training or what we’ve had to train with, our goal has remained the same – to provide our community of Scunthorpe and North Lincolnshire with the finest Martial Arts education we can offer.

We are blessed to have an incredible team of dedicated instructors including Master grades in both our key martial arts.

At the core of the team Master Smith and wife Lisa Smith work to maintain the family values of the school. Although several of the instructors share the Smith surname it is only coincidence.

Most of our instructors joined Twin Tigers to follow their own path many years ago and have since decided to share the life skills and benefits they found with others.

Twin Tigers is dedicated to developing our students, through a martial arts education.

Our instruction team work tirelessly to get the best out of each student. We ensure that our student’s progression is earned, never given. No matter the skill level or ability, we tailor our student’s experiences to secure the best Martial Arts education possible, for children, adults and everyone in between, we have a class for you.

We believe not only do we have the best instruction team in the area, we also have the best facilities by far

name: Welcome Home
description:
It can be quite daunting going home from hospital whether you're on your own or going home to family.  The Welcome Home Service will support you and your family on discharge from hospital.  Ask your nursing team for a referral, or any of the Welcome Home and Acute responders present in the hospital - they are the team in the blue citizens T-Shirts. You may also self-refer using the contact number below. We will arrange a visit from our fully trained responders to call 24-48hrs on arrival home.

We will help you to safely settle back home and help you find support in your community with services such as social prescribing and befriending services. From that first emergency shop on arriving home or collecting your medication to getting benefit support. We will take time to listen to your needs and support you as best we can.

​​​​​​​We are a non-medical, non-care service totally free service. You will need a referral from your nursing team before you are are discharged from hospital.

01724 298558

organization.name: Welcome Home
organization.description:
Welcome home supports you and your family when returning home from hospital.  (We are a non-medical service)

We will arrange a responder to visit who will help to identify any needs you may have.

name: Wellbeing and Young Carers Team
description:
A young carer is someone under the age of 18 who assists in the care or support of someone in their family or a friend who has:

  • a disability
  •  illness or long term health condition
  • a mental health condition
  • misuses drugs or alcohol.

The term “young carer” does not apply to the everyday and occasional help around the home that may often be expected of or given by children in families.

What might a young carer do?

  • practical tasks such as cooking, housework and shopping
  • physical care such as helping someone out of bed
  • emotional support
  • personal care such as helping someone to dress
  • managing the family budget
  • helping to give medications
  • looking after brothers and sisters.

Young carers can learn lots of useful skills and be well adapted to their circumstances. However, it is also important to recognise some of the challenges young carers may face, including the impact on their emotional or physical wellbeing, education and social opportunities.

There are an estimated 700,000 young carers across the UK. Here in North Lincolnshire we strive to ensure that young carers within our area are identified at the earliest opportunity to ensure that the right type of support is offered at the right time.

What does the Wellbeing and Young Carers Team provide?

  • When a child is providing care, or is intending to provide care, they are entitled to an assessment of their needs as a young carer. The team uses a whole family approach to consider the needs of other family members including the cared for person.
  • Information, advice and support in relation to reducing higher levels of caring, exploring ways to reduce the impact of caring and, if required, supporting the young carer in their understanding of the cared for person’s condition.
  • Help for young carers to access adult services carer support on turning 18.
  • Opportunities to have a break from caring responsibilities, including access to life skill courses such as first aid.
  • Information and advice to other services and schools to ensure that our partners are assisting in the early identification and support of young carers.
  • Information and advice in relation to other support and services available in the area.
  • Young carers and their families have a right to be well informed about services available to them should they wish to access them. This will help to reduce situations in families when there is a change of circumstance that may lead to a crisis and potentially the need for emergency support.

How do I make a referral?

Anyone can make a referral to the Wellbeing and Young Carer Team. This includes, families, schools, social care and health services.

Young Carers' referral form

Contact us on 01724 297000 and speak to one of our young carer support staff.

Services and other professionals referring in may be asked to provide an Early Help Assessment supporting the referral.

organization.name: North Lincolnshire Council
organization.description: Local Council serving the residents of North Lincolnshire

name: Wellness Recovery Action Plan
description:
Wellness Recovery Action Planning (WRAP) is a personal framework to give you ways of feeling better and managing your symptoms. It is a useful way of organising a lot of the techniques or wellness tools that you may already use for easy reference and recognising any triggers that may cause you to feel unwell.

It helps you to learn about yourself and can develop alongside your own recovery. WRAP is run every Monday from 2pm to 3:30pm. If you want to attend WRAP sessions please call us on 01724 279500 to book an initial assessment appointment.

organization.name: North Lincolnshire Mind
organization.description:
We are here to help you in your recovery journey and whenever you need mental health support. We believe that everyone should have access to good mental health support whenever they need it.

Here at North Lincolnshire Mind, we have created a safe and supportive environment where we provide a variety of services from 1 to 1 Confidential Listening service to recovery-focused groups and social support sessions.

name: Westwoodside Playing Field and Pavillion
description:
Make use of excellent facilities on your doorstep! 

All of our facilities here at Westwood Playing Field are available to hire by both clubs and individuals at very competitive rates (see our facilities page for details). We can provide an excellent space for events of all types and for all ages from a child's birthday party to an anniversary party. 

Our Pavilion rooms provide the perfect place for a local committee meeting and can be hired on a regular basis for clubs such as Brownies, Rainbows, Scouts, Guides etc. We now offer a larger space that could be utilised for day care, fitness classes, coffee mornings and anything else that you could think of?

Our aim is to have the facility in constant use, becoming a hub of the local community.

Why not hire the sports court or football pitch for your child's birthday party, have a good kick around, then use the facilities to end the day with a party? See our facilities page for competitive rates or call us for any other enquiries 07771 828727

name: Wheelchair Basketball
description: Wheelchair Basketball fun for all regardless of age or ability. This is all-inclusive so parents or carers can even join in with the children and is not just for disabled people.

organization.name: Steelers Wheelers Wheelchair Basketball
organization.description:
Wheelchair basketball for all, able bodied or disabled
Steelers Wheelers offers people with disabilities the opportunity to take part in sport. We are a fully inclusive sport so that anyone can have go, regardless of their physical abilities.

Why the community needs us
Steelers Wheelers is the only wheelchair basketball sports club within a 25 mile radius of Scunthorpe.

Our impact on the community
We regularly have 20 people attend wheelchair basketball sessions each week, although the club has 30+ members. Half our membership have disabilities and are able to participate along side our able bodied members. Our club provides competitive inclusive sport, but is also a great social activity where everyone, regardless of their ability can get involved and have fun.

name: Wheels2work Team
description:
Wheels 2 Work North Lincolnshire is a moped and electric bicycle hire scheme. It helps people get over the problem of getting to work, college or training because of genuine transport difficulties. We have both electric and petrol mopeds within the fleet.

Please note:

The scheme is open only to people who live in North Lincolnshire. If you don’t live in North Lincolnshire, search the internet to find a Wheels 2 Work scheme in your area.

Further information and how to apply is on the council website - Wheels 2 Work North Lincolnshire - North Lincolnshire Council (northlincs.gov.uk)

organization.name: Wheels2Work
organization.description:
Wheels 2 Work North Lincolnshire is a moped and electric bicycle hire scheme. It helps people get over the problem of getting to work, college or training because of genuine transport difficulties. We have both electric and petrol mopeds within the fleet.

The scheme is open only to people who live in North Lincolnshire. If you don’t live in North Lincolnshire, search the internet to find a Wheels 2 Work scheme in your area.

name: Whist
description:
Every Wednesday at 7pm.

24 hands plus 5 hand miniature.

£3 includes free members draw.

organization.name: Lincoln Gardens Community Centre
organization.description: Lincoln Gardens Community Centre hosts a range of activities including table top sales, whist drives, bingo, and much more. All welcome. Please contact for more details.

name: Why Weight? Weight Loss Programme - Healthy Lifestyles
description:
Our Why Weight? weight loss groups are aimed at improving overall health and wellbeing. After an initial assessment with our team, you will be able to join the Why Weight? Programme!

FREE 8-week supportive, fun and friendly course
Led by experts, supporting your weight loss journey
Learn about your food intake
Discover new and simple ways to exercise
Lifestyle tips to help you keep on track
Face to Face and virtual support
Additional 5-week menopause support programme available 
Held in community hubs and venues throughout North Lincolnshire, our groups provide advice on all aspects of healthy living in a relaxed, friendly environment.

Course registration is available by bookable appointment only. For more information on how our Why Weight? Weight loss groups can support you, or to book in, contact Healthy Lifestyles to speak with a member of our team!

organization.name: North Lincolnshire Healthy Lifestyles
organization.description:
The North Lincolnshire Healthy Lifestyle team brings together lifestyle support services in one place. This makes it easier for local people to access help and support for a range of issues at once.

You can access the team at local venues such as leisure centres, community hubs, and some GP practices.

Our friendly healthy lifestyle facilitators can support you with:

achieving and maintaining a healthy weight
stopping smoking
reducing alcohol use
signposting to wider local supporting services
Our service is available via self referrals or referrals made through your GP practice.

name: WI socialising opportunity
description: We meet once a month of the second Wednesday, between 10-12. A local opportunity to make new friends, socialise over a cuppa and hear from a variety of speakers across the year!

organization.name: Brigg Morning WI
organization.description: A Morning WI group held in St John's Church Hall in Brigg on the 2nd Wednesday of the month at 10am.

name: Willow Bird Workshop
description:
Learn to make your own chicken or pheasant to roost at home or in your garden. These characterful random weave sculptures are a good introduction to working with willow. Suitable for beginners.

Please wear clothes that you are happy getting a bit grubby and full shoes that cover your toes.

£75pp

name: Wiltshire Farm Foods
description:
We deliver nutritious and delicious frozen meals direct to your door.  The meals can be cooked in the microwave direct from frozen making them easy to prepare and safer and cheaper than putting the oven on. 

We have a range of three sizes of meals, allergen free meals, vegetarian meals, softer meals for people who have difficulty with dysphagia or swallowing.  Our food is made without preservatives as it is frozen immediately on production.  It tastes fantastic and we win awards for the quality of the meals. 

They are easy to order, phone us on 01427 666130 between 8am-5pm Monday-Friday.  Order via the website https://wiltshirefarmfoods.com/ or we have an app on a smart mobile. 

There are no contracts, no minimum orders, no delivery charges.  Our drivers are police checked and are lovely chaps, they will put the food away in the freezer for customers.  They will also do the odd small job for customers.  Put the bins out, change light bulbs, move furniture for you to hoover.  Anything which only takes a couple of minutes. 

Our motto is 'Good Old Fashioned Service', you will receive this from the people in the office who will be patient with you and chat as you order to the drivers who get to know you and think of you as a friend.

organization.name: Wiltshire Farm Foods
organization.description:
For over 30 years, we've been cooking and delivering delicious frozen meals for you to enjoy whenever you like.

Our recipe is simple: over 330 tasty, easy to cook meals made from quality ingredients plus good old-fashioned service. Our friendly local team delivers free to your door whenever you want. They always go the extra mile and are happy to put your meals away in the freezer for you if you’d like

Want to get started? Simply place your order online today - you can order as often or as little as you like, there's no contract, just good old-fashioned service.

name: Winterton Community Hub
description:
Winterton Community Hub is an integrated facility offering information advice and guidance on Council and community services, a modern 28 station gym facility and skate park.

Services include-information advice and guidance, a library, access to computers and the internet, plus group activities for children and adults.

The team working at the Community Hub can signpost you to services and information, assist with digital application forms for things like blue badge applications, benefits, and travel passes. They can help you to get online, scan and print documents, and find out what is happening locally.

The Community Hub is a space for the community to come together to connect, learn, give, be active and take notice –contributing to the wellbeing of people locally.

organization.name: North Lincolnshire Community Hubs
organization.description:
North Lincolnshire Council connects residents with their communities through a network of locality-based community hubs enabling independence and wellbeing. 
The Community Hubs support residents by providing a safe environment to access information, activities, skills and services, and by providing the tools to enhance personal knowledge, confidence and a sense of belonging.  
The majority of North Lincolnshire residents live within a 15 minute drive of their local community hub. Hubs are located in each of the following locations Scunthorpe, Brigg, Barton, Crowle, Epworth, Ashby & Riddings.

name: Winterton Men in Sheds
description:
Winterton Men in Sheds is for anyone age 18 years+. It's a place where you can make new friends and get involved in activities as much or little as you want to. The kettle is always on and the banter is always interesting!

Shed members attend as many times each week as they choose to, and have the opportunity to use any of the Shed equipment to pursue a hobby, make or mend things for themselves or others, and get involved in supporting the local community. We have made wooden games for events, repaired benches, fixed furniture and much more. It's not all about wood work though. We are always interested to see what other hobbies people are interested in. 

The Shed is a great place to make new friends, feel part of the community and, if you wish to, use your skills to make a difference. You don't have to be a resident of Winterton to attend - everyone welcome. 

We know that things can be difficult, financially, for some people at the moment, so join us now and take advantage of free membership. 

We are open weekdays, Monday to Friday from 9am to 11.30am. Find us on Kings Street, Winterton, opposite Tescos.
pc_attendingAccess_additionalInfo: We can accommodate people using wheelchairs, however we do not have disabled toilet facilities due to the layout of the building.

organization.name: Winterton Men in Sheds
organization.description:
We are a community group and registered charity. Our shed is open to everybody and a place to relax, make friends, chat and enjoy tea and biscuits!  
The main function of the shed is companionship whilst creating many wonderful things.  We have repaired things for the community such as benches, fences etc, and as long as we have the skill set we will try everything.

name: Winterton Senior Forum
description:
Winterton Senior Citizens Forum formed in 2007, with a Moto “ Your Forum-Your Voice ” are a group of older and disabled people, who come together to meet up socially monthly in support of the older community.

We discuss local, regional, and national issues of the day and enjoy social events and to plan away days.

We provide a platform of opportunity for Service Providers to offer their services and keep members fully updated on important changes and opportunities relating to older people.

We are supported by North Lincolnshire Council, and they will help organise speakers when required to give the group further information and advice on matters that have arisen.

The group meets on the second Thursday of the month at Trinity Methodist Church, Winterton. 1.30 to 3.30pm, there is a nominal charge to cover refreshments on the day.

For further information please contact Jim on 07808 201244 or Paula on 07717 570640

Please speak to Paula or Jim for advice on costings.

organization.name: Winterton Senior Forum
organization.description:
Winterton Senior Citizens Forum formed in 2007, with a Moto “ Your Forum-Your Voice ” are a group of older and disabled people, who come together to meet up socially monthly in support of the Older Community.

We discuss local, regional, and national issues of the day and  enjoy social events and to plan away days.
We provide a platform of opportunity for Service Providers to offer their services and keep members fully updated on important changes and opportunities relating to older people.

We are supported by North Lincolnshire Council, and they will help organise speakers when required to give the group further information and advice on matters that have arisen.

The group meets on the second Thursday of the month at Trinity Methodist Church, Winterton. 1.30 to 3.30pm, there is a nominal charge to cover refreshments on the day.

For further information please contact Jim on 07808 201244  or Paula on 07717 570640

name: Wire Chandelier for the Garden
description:
Create a Wire Chandelier for the Garden with Anna Roebuck. Learn various wire forming techniques and create a wonderful chandelier for your garden or as indoor decor for your home. The chandelier is designed for use with LED tealight candles (these are not included in the price, but Anna will recommend a couple of options of where and what to buy).

The workshop is suitable for anyone and is a nice way to learn basic metalwork skills. Please note though, wirework can be tiring on your hands, so do bear this in mind if you have any issues with hand strength.

You’ll get a handout to remind you of how to do the basics as well as suggestions for suppliers so you can make more at home.

The workshop is with Anna Roebuck, who began to develop wire flowers in response to a Remembrance day commission and has since gone on to explore making different types of flowers, bees and now dragonflies out of wire.

£95pp

name: Wire Dragonfly Sculpture Workshop
description:
Create a Wire Dragonfly Sculpture for the garden with Anna Roebuck. Learn various wire forming techniques and create a wonderful everlasting dragonfly for your garden.

You can choose the colour of your dragonfly, but Anna will need to know in advance which colour you would like to make. Please give your colour preference at the time of booking or email us your choice when booking online – craft@the-ropewalk.co.uk. You can choose between: (Green - Teal), (Blue - Teal), (Pink - Purple), (Blue - Purple)

The workshop is suitable for anyone and is a nice way to learn basic metalwork and jewellery making skills. Please note though, wirework can be tiring on your hands, so do bear this in mind if you have any issues with hand strength.

You’ll get a handout to remind you of how to do the basics as well as suggestions for suppliers so you can make more at home

£95pp

name: With Me in Mind: Our Service
description:
With Me in Mind is a school based service working with children and young people who need support with their mental health and emotional wellbeing.

We can help with:

  • Low mood
  • Fears
  • Stress
  • Worries
  • Emotional Difficulties

We offer FREE parent workshops across a wide range of subjects, we offer FREE wellbeing activities during the school holidays and we offer 1-1 support to parents where appropriate. 

To access our service make contact with your child's Mental Health Lead within their school, they will be responsible for referring into our service.

You can speak to one of our Practitioners about referring your child into our service via eClinic, this is a instant messaging appointment where you can get support and advice from a member of our team:


https://withmeinmind.co.uk/with-me-in-mind-eclinics/

We promote our service and events on social media, you can follow us on Facebook and Instagram @withmeinmindnorthlincs

organization.name: With Me in Mind
organization.description:
With Me in Mind is the name of one of the national Mental Health Support Teams (MHSTs). Our service was identified following the release of the Government Green Paper (2017), “Transforming Children and Young People’s Mental Health” in which there was a focus on earlier intervention and prevention, especially in, and linked to schools and colleges. One of the core proposals from the paper was to fund new Mental Health Support Teams, which are predominantly being supervised by NHS Children and Young People’s Mental Health Services as well as local charity/private services.

We are committed to ensuring that the Mental Health Support Teams reach those most in need of the support; presently we are a working in selected educational settings across Doncaster, Rotherham and North Lincolnshire. Part of this initiative also offers support to those students not in mainstream education and includes working in some Doncaster and North Lincolnshire Special Education Schools, Doncaster Home Educated Pupils and to pupils attending certain Alternative Provisions in Rotherham and North Lincolnshire.

name: Women's Only Drop In
description:
A women's only session run by Blue Door on a Monday afternoon. 

Blue door staff will be available to answer any questions, provide guidance and support to women presenting for the sessions.

Pop in for a coffee and chat.

organization.name: Victor House
organization.description:
Victor House Is a Safe Hub offering vital support to people who are homeless or at risk of homelessness. Victor House opens seven days a week, including Christmas Day 2-6pm and Boxing Day 8-10pm providing hot drinks  and donations of food are provided when available, essential support services are offered based upon, strength based conversations and care & support needs identified. 
Showering/laundry facilities are also available.

Night Provision is available and this is based on visitors completing a form daily - with support - from the team at Victor House in order for application to be considered based on priority need.

name: Yoga & Mindfulness MBSR Classes
description:
Yoga & Mindfulness classes available in Brigg, Scunthorpe and Epworth North Lincolnshire.

Please visit the website for details of the classes.

organization.name: Stuarts Yoga & Mindfulness
organization.description: Yoga and Mindfulness MBSR Teacher

name: Yoga - Living Later Life Well
description: Open to anybody aged 60+ - join us for an hour of Yoga to gentle music, focussing on improving stamina, strength and flexibility. Exercises are adapted to all abilities; please bring a roll-up exercise mat, a bottle of water and wear comfortable clothing. New starters will be asked to complete a brief medical form on arrival. Just turn up, no need to book!

organization.name: Living Later Life Well Project
organization.description: Living Later Life Well is a community engagement project for people aged 60+ to reduce loneliness.

name: Yoga / Chair Yoga / Pilates Classes
description:
“Helping people to achieve better health, fitness & balance by embracing a wellbeing lifestyle through yoga, meditation, Pilates, personal training and healthy eating” 

I offer yoga sessions and classes with mindfulness and meditation, as I believe the three are fundamentally connected. I also offer chair yoga, gentle yoga and Fascia yoga within my workshops or as a class. I can also offer you tailor made 1:1 sessions in all of these.

Additionally, I offer mindfulness and meditation sessions and 1:1 private appointments.

Yoga

Tuesday - 6pm - 7.30pm - Demeter House School, Bigby Street, Brigg, DN20 8EF

Thursday - 6pm - 7.30pm - Demeter House School, Bigby Street, Brigg, DN20 8EF

Pilates:

Wednesday - 6.30pm - 7.30pm - Demeter House School, Bigby Street, Brigg, DN20 8EF

Wednesday - 10.30am - 11.30am - Scawby Village Hall, Scawby, DN20 9AT

Chair Yoga:

Wednesday - 12pm - 1pm - Scawby Village Hall, Scawby, DN20 9AT

PLEASE CONTACT ME TO CHECK AVAILABILITY FOR THE CLASS YOU WOULD LIKE TO ATTEND.

I can work 1:1 with clients or small groups in the work place or in the comfort of your home. Working on your long term and short term goal setting, through yoga practice, meditation and personal training and Pilates and by utilising my life coach training and health and nutrition advice.

Give me a call on 07523 096184 or message me if you would like more information about what I can do for you!

organization.name: Health & Life Balance with Clair Stamp
organization.description: Yoga Teacher, Mindfulness & Meditation Teacher, Nutrition Advice & Support, Personal Trainer, Pilates Instructor, Life Coach based in Brigg

name: Yoga / Pilates Flow
description:
Body Yoga/Pilates Flow

This is a unique class which incorporates yoga and pilates in which you will increase flexibility and increase strength.

organization.name: Sue Wakefield Fitness
organization.description:
I have been teaching different classes at many different gyms, fitness centres and other venues for over 35 years now. I started fitness quite late on in life doing the initial training with my daughter as she didn’t want to do it on her own and from then on I was hooked and have never looked back.

Well firstly my participants are my priority and I understand that to enjoy a class you need to feel welcome and safe; you need to know its ok if the class is moving in one direction and you’re going in the other its fine. Everybody does it so you’re not the first and won’t be the last.

I think my classes have been popular for so many years is because they are fun, hey even I go wrong but we can laugh about it.

Its important you work at a level that feels good for you and you are in an environment that allows this.

I know there are barriers to fitness for many people but hopefully the classes can help remove some of those for you and leave you feeling empowered and crush any doubts you may had about yourself and abilities.

name: Yoga Relaxation & Soundbath Sessions
description:
Breath work and sound has long been used as an introductory practice for meditation. 

This is a wonderful way to relax and let go of stress and strain in body and mind opening you up to a lighter and more relaxed way of being.

Join in and practice some yoga pranayama breathing techniques for calming and balancing the body and mind then prepare to lay down on a comfy mat with blanket and pillows to listen to the sounds from crystal bowls, tuning forks, gong, drum, chimes etc. The soundbath experience can be deeply relaxing and leave you feeling refreshed and renewed in body mind and soul. 

Sessions must be booked in advance.

For details of sessions and how to book please visit: https://www.kirtoninlindsey.com/yogarelaxation

organization.name: kirtoninlindsey.com
organization.description:
kirtoninlindsey.com is a community website featuring information on all facilities, community groups, fitness classes and useful links in the area.

Kirton in Lindsey is a picturesque town in Lincolnshire and is situated approximately an hour’s drive from the cities of Leeds and Sheffield, and only 30 minutes from Lincoln.

name: Yoga Therapy For You - Yoga Studio & Yoga Online Services
description:
Yoga Therapy For You

Established Yoga Studio based in Epworth North Lincolnshire 

Founded by Carmen Bratton - Senior Yoga Teacher & Yoga Therapist 

Offering:

*Various Yoga Classes For All Abilities 

*Livestream Zoom Classes

*Yoga On Demand - Subscription Service

*One to One Private Tuition 

*Yoga Therapy 

*Sound Therapy 

*Monthly Workshops and Soundbath Sessions 

Easy online booking system 

Full timetable available on my website 

Visit: https://yogatherapyforyou.as.me/ To Book 

Any enquiries please get in touch

Follow on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/yogatherapyforyou

Follow on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/yogatherapyforyou/

organization.name: Yoga Therapy For You
organization.description:
Hello, I’m Carmen.
I’m the founder of Yoga Therapy For You, a senior yoga teacher with Yoga Alliance Professionals and a Yoga Therapy Practitioner registered with the Complementary & Natural Healthcare Council (CNHC) 

I have been teaching for over 12 years and have studied with many incredible teachers throughout this time. Always a student and recently became a Sound Therapist after studying with the British Academy Of Sound Therapy.
I’m passionate about promoting healing, vitality and wellbeing through the practice of yoga and sound.

“I stumbled upon yoga unexpectedly”

It all began because I was overwhelmed with work, working through grief, my body stiff, self esteem low, struggling with weight gain and was experiencing huge hormonal shifts. I was feeling completely lost and my health and wellbeing was deteriorating.

I needed change, and so joined a gym and quickly realised it wasn’t my cup of tea! I was about to give up when I discovered  yoga classes on the timetable. 

I remember my first class, sat on a yoga mat thinking what am I doing here, I can’t even touch my toes...never in a million years would I have known that day would change my life..

 The stretching felt so good, and with practice the stillness of my mind and body in relaxation became a welcome gift, a huge wake up call to self care!!

name: Young Minds
description:
We are Young Minds 

Our purpose 

To stop young people's mental health reaching crisis point.

Every young person whose mental health ends up in crisis is a young person who has been failed. We know that the earlier young people can access the right help, the more likely it is that they can avoid these crises.

Our vision

A world where no young person feels alone with their mental health.

We want to see a world where every young person who is struggling feels able to reach out, and has people and services around them who can really help.

Our mission

To make sure all young people can get the mental health support they need, when they need it, no matter what.

Whether they need a reassuring conversation, specialist mental health support, or simply the knowledge that they are not alone in how they are feeling, we will make sure that all young people get support that meets them where they're at as quickly as possible.

Our values

  • We're not afraid to speak up for what's right.

    We know what needs to change because young people tell us. If they raise their voices, so do we.

  • We're optimistic.

    Things get tough, but we never forget to celebrate progress and never stop looking for practical ways to make things better.

  • Kindness is our strength.

    Everything we do, we do with love, care and compassion.

  • We celebrate what makes you, you.

    Whoever you are, we welcome you and encourage you to always be true to yourself.

We are leading the movement to make sure every young person gets the mental health support they need, when they need it, no matter what.

It takes courage to ask for help. But for many young people who do, the support they need just isn’t there.

If you feel you would benefit from the support of Young Minds, please visit their website https://www.youngminds.org.uk/ for access to a range of information and articles. 

If you would like to speak someone regarding needing urgent mental health support - please visit Get Urgent Help | Support If You're Struggling | YoungMinds for access to a range of telephone services that are available 24/7.

organization.name: Young Minds
organization.description:
We’re the UK’s leading charity fighting for children and young people's mental health.

We want to see a world where no young person feels alone with their mental health, and all young people get the mental health support they need, when they need it, no matter what.

name: Young Onset Dementia Carers Peer Support group
description:
An online peer to Peer Support Group for family members caring for a loved one with Young Onset Dementia.

Please visit the website for details of how to book.

organization.name: TIDE (Together in Dementia Everyday)
organization.description:
Imagine a collective of unpaid carers of people with dementia with the advocacy skills, knowledge and passion for making positive change for everyone impacted by dementia. Thanks to the work of tide, you don’t have to imagine. Tide works side by side with carers to ensure that their voices are heard. The foundations of tide were born out of the daily struggle that a group of women experienced in looking after family members with dementia. They decided that they did not want their experiences to become a reality for future carers. Out of this powerful commitment, tide the charity was born.  

Here at tide, we walk alongside carers. Every step of the way.  All that we do is grounded in the experience of the thousands of carers we have worked with over the years. We are continually inspired by the courageous people who come forward to add their voice to a growing movement. We see their confidence grow and lives change as carers realise the powerful impact of their voices. This is what motivates us. This is what keeps us moving forward.  

Whether you are a current or former carer of someone with dementia, or a professional working with carers, tide is here for you. Join us and let's make the world a better place for everyone living with dementia in the UK.

Meet other people within our Family Hubs.

6pm - 7.30pm

name: Youth History Group
description:
North Lincolnshire Museum is inviting 13-16 year olds with an interest in archaeology, history and Museums to take part in a brand new project. The group will explore the Museum’s collections, find out more about our local history and work towards creating a Museum display for others to enjoy in the Summer.

Positive Activities support a range of activities for young people to enjoy and have paid for these pilot sessions. However, we do ask that members commit to all six of the sessions as we work towards creating our final piece to share with others. Please book a ticket for each session.

Sessions must be booked online and the Participation Agreement must be completed and returned to the team at least one week before the first session.

https://north-lincolnshire-council.arttickets.org.uk

organization.name: North Lincolnshire Museum
organization.description:
Discover the history of North Lincolnshire at our free museum near the centre of Scunthorpe.

A visit to the Museum is a step back in time through fascinating hands-on displays. Learn about some of North Lincolnshire’s amazing objects and stories. Explore the geology, local history and archaeology galleries. Discover how that history has been shaped by the landscape. Families can visit Dudley’s Den, a dedicated Under 5s space.

With a changing programme of family friendly exhibitions and events for all ages. Families can join Dudley Bear and explore by taking part in fun filled activities and crafts. Learn about North Lincolnshire with trails, back packs and family explorer packs.

Admission is free.

name: Zumba Gold
description:
Zumba Gold Classes 

Perfect For anyone who is looking for a modified Zumba® class that recreates the original moves you love at a lower-intensity.


How It Works

The design of the class introduces easy-to-follow Zumba® choreography that focuses on balance, range of motion and coordination. Come ready to sweat, and prepare to leave empowered and feeling strong.

Benefits

Class focuses on all elements of fitness: cardiovascular, muscular conditioning, flexibility and balance!

Come Join the Party. Our super class is easy to follow and still high on fun.  It's exercise in disguise.

Cost:

All classes are £5 each.

description:
Seated Zumba® Gold dance fitness classes for anybody wanting a fun, effective workout without any standing or floor exercises.

Do YOU really need to get more active but may struggle with a regular fitness class?

Do YOU struggle finding exercise that you enjoy and find fun?

Would YOU like to improve muscle tone, mobility & flexibility?

Would YOU like to torch those calories whilst safely sat in a chair?

YOU are not alone. Come join us on and be surprised at just how much fun you can have with this effective and completely chair-based class.

Every Friday 11.15am -12pm, Brumby Community Centre, £4.

organization.name: Zumba Gold
organization.description:
Super fun, low impact exercise classes. Groove at your own pace with Zumba Gold & splash yourself fit with Aquacise
The easy-to-follow program that lets you move to the beat at your own speed. It's and invigorating, community-oriented dance-fitness class that feels fresh, and most of all, exhilarating! Zumba Gold provides modified, low-impact moves and easy-to-follow pacing for healthy, active lifestyle!
Fitsteps is the new dance craze! Do you love Strictly Come Dancing and want to dance like the stars? This is the fitness class for you. Created by Natalie Lowe & Ian Waite, waltz your way to weight loss.
